title: Boyhood
label: Mayhap
description: The Wichita collective issues a dense, occasionally confounding debut about the fallibility of memory and the innocence of youth.

title: Touch Up
label: Last Gang
description: Vancouver-based indie rock band offers acute, snappy pop songs with no discernible signs of the elbow grease it took to craft them.

title: Living With the Living
label: Touch and Go
description: More expansive and prettier than anything this D.C. band has done yet, the group's fifth album sounds most like a step on from 2001's The Tyranny of Distance, which was the sound of R.E.M.-style jangle pulled taut until it turned to punk.

title: Out of the Woods
label: Astralwerks
description: Out of the Woods

title: Touched
label: Alien8
description: Touched

title: Pagoda
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Actor Michael Pitt-- best known for his Kurt Cobain impersonation in the Gus Van Zant film Last Days-- does another take on Cobain on this record, issued by Thurston Moore's Ecstatic Peace.

title: Like Love Lust and the Open Halls of the Soul
label: Barsuk
description: After two albums of lustrous folk rock this band's latest is as adventurous as that lengthy title promises, changing up its moods and music and taking the group outside of its comfort zone.

title: Rio Baile Funk: More Favela Booty Beats
label: Essay
description: In the second volume of this compilation of this supposedly ephemeral sound you can hear snatches of a potential sonic future emerging from the sedimented pop culture muck of the past.

title: The Weirdness
label: Virgin
description: The Stooges reunite for just their fourth album and first in 34 years. Mike Watt takes over for the late Dave Alexander on bass and Steve Albini serves as engineer.

title: Sound of Silver
label: EMI
description: James Murphy offers his second multi-track album as LCD Soundsystem, and it's as close to a perfect hybrid of dance and rock music's values as you're likely to ever hear.

title: Seven Sisters
label: Monika
description: Berlin-based songwriter Sabrina Milena's full-length debut is colored by electronics and samples combining with acoustic instruments and odd synths, but is highlighted by her nicotine-stained croon.

title: Sirs
label: Fat Cat
description: Seattle foursome's Fat Cat debut will make 90s indie rock fans wistful for the days of the Grifters and Archers of Loaf.

title: Labrador 100, a Complete History of Popular Music
label: Labrador
description: The Sarah Records-like Swedish indie pop label celebrates its 10th anniversary with a 4xCD collection that features one song from each of its first 100 releases.

title: Tongues
label: Domino
description: The latest collaboration between Four Tet and the legendary drummer  enforces pop-like rules on their improvisations.

title: We Were Dead Before the Ship Even Sank
label: Epic
description: Modest Mouse follow the unlikely success of "Float On" by recruiting former Smiths guitarist Johnny Marr and gently nudging toward new directions. The Shins' James Mercer guests.

title: Ocky Milk
label: American Patchwork
description: Nick Currie's 19th album as Momus is as wordy and culturally adroit as one would expect it to be, but it also displays a new embrace of restraint and minimalism.

title: Wolves
label: The Worker's Institute
description: Literate indie pop from Glasgow that veers between hushed, intimate storytelling and roaring orchestral climaxes.

title: Scribble Mural Comic Journal
label: Notenuf
description: Philadelphia tweegazers keep up ambient-pop's ethereal flame, losing themselves in the trebly haze of early Creation Records, pop melodies barely shining through all the layers of noise.

title: I’ll Sleep When You’re Dead
label: Definitive Jux
description: The long-awaited follow-up to 2002's Fantastic Damage is more textured and melodic than its predecessor, but El-P's production is still amongst the most jarring in hip-hop and here the Def Jux rapper's themes and shading remain pitched to black, haunted by the prospect of a dystopian near-future.

title: Plays
label: Ache
description: Plays

title: The Peel Session EP
label: Fat Cat
description: Recorded in 2002 for the late John Peel, three of this EP's four songs draw from the Icelandic band's debut LP and career highlight Yesterday Was Dramatic - Today Is OK.

title: Knive
label: Type
description: Norwegian composer Erik K. Skodvin's debut full-length hums with a romantic, bleak, and morose melancholia-- something both emotionally and sonically heavy.

title: Raven and the White Night
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Jagjaguwar band rather surprisingly turn in a stunning, balanced work of studio craft and orchestration.

title: Steingarten
label: ~scape
description: Berlin studio mastermind and ~scape label proprietor Stefan Betke's latest in gurgling, crackling dub reductionism brims with ideas and vitality.

title: Drums and Guns
label: Sub Pop
description: The slowcore pioneers revisit many of the dark meditations of their album Trust, with touches of The Great Destroyer's nihilism and legacy-toying and the production experiments of the Songs for a Dead Pilot EP on these brutal pop songs.

title: Vessels
label: 4AD
description: Australia's newest wolf-related metal band balances sludgy atmosphere with fuzzy Fillmore psychedelia.

title: If This World Were Mine...
label: Daptone
description: The Daptone label unearths a long-buried and low-budget soul nugget from early-70s Buffalo, featuring the vocals of teenage pals Bobby Nunn and Eugene Coplin.

title: Secret Lawns
label: Fryk Beat
description: Portland bedroom producer debuts with an album of Prince-worshiping, budget-priced r&b.

title: Songs For the Young at Heart
label: Lucky Dog
description: Tindersticks' Stuart Staples and David Boulter compile a children's record for grown-ups, featuring Jarvis Cocker, Bonnie "Prince" Billy, and Stuart Murdoch.

title: Turn the Lights Out
label: Matador
description: Chicago indie rock band's third album (and first for Matador) is its first with Brian Case, formerly of 90 Day Men, as well as the group's most consistent to date.

title: If the Ocean Gets Rough
label: Astralwerks
description: On his Astralwerks debut and second album overall, this troubador's homespun songs rest in a bed of alt-country and 1970s singer-songwriter sonic signifiers.

title: The Bride of Dynamite
label: Gnomonsong
description: Gnomonsong-signed vocalist/instrumentalist Danielle Stech-Homsy is the latest ethereal, folk-inclined female artist to be boosted by Devendra Banhart. Andy Cabic and CocoRosie's Sierra Casady make cameos.

title: What a Beautiful Place
label: Reflection
description: Numero Group unearths the long-lost 1971 debut album from a young singer-songwriter with an ageless voice and surprisingly mature arrangements.

title: Stax 50th Anniversary Celebration
label: Stax
description: This 2xCD, 50-track collection celebrates the golden anniversary of the iconic Memphis label and features tracks by Otis Redding, Carla Thomas, Booker T. & the MGs, Sam & Dave, Isaac Hayes, and many more.

title: Live at Massey Hall
label: Reprise
description: The second live release in Neil Young's long-awaited and now briskly paced Archives series, is a stark, fragile solo performance, an abrupt shift from last year's Live at Fillmore East, a disc of barnstorming distortion-pedal epics recorded with Crazy Horse.

title: The Get Down EP
label: self-released
description: Young Berkeley band evokes Bloc Party and Q and Not U with its jagged, melodious dancepunk and good-natured urgency.

title: Memoirs
label: Columbia
description: Five-piece band from Surrey moves from garage rock to mall-punk, obsessing over teenage heartbreak while bringing the big choruses.

title: Hidden World
label: Jade Tree
description: After a series of EPs and seven-inches, this post-hardcore, Jade Tree-signed punk band unleashes its excellent debut. Final Fantasy provides the string arrangements.

title: Reformation Post TLC
label: Narnack
description: Mark E. Smith's unlikely music institution tries to keep its 00s Narnack-signed winning streak intact on this album, recorded in L.A. at the end of the group's ill-fated 2006 U.S. tour.

title: The Information: Deluxe Edition
label: Interscope
description: Beck's 2006 album is reissued as a 2xCD package with all of its attendant videos and remixes from Ellen Allien, Villalobos, and David Sitek, among others

title: Music for Tourists
label: Absolutely Kosher
description: Wispy-voiced Brooklyn balladeer wallows in the archetypal misery of Elliott Smith-- and even covers "Between the Bars". The cover art says it all.

title: This Too Will Pass
label: Dangerbird
description: Introspective singer/songwriter Hrishikesh Hirway pairs with violinist Jane Yakowitz for an album of quiet bedroom electronica.

title: Cheeseburger
label: Kemado
description: Stooges-inspired Brooklyn louts kick out greasy, sloppy, unapologetically American rock and roll.

title: The Frozen Borderline: 1968-1970
label: Rhino
description: This 2xCD release combines 1968's The Marble Index and 1970's Desertshore, appending 18 alternate versions to the pair's original 16 songs.

title: The Third Hand
label: XL
description: One of underground hip-hop's best producers turns his back on his previous work and fashions a rock album built from flashes of indie pop touchstones like Stereolab, Syd Barrett-era Floyd, and the Zombies.

title: Please Heat This Eventually EP
label: Gold Standard Laboratories
description: Mars Volta guitarist's second in a series of side project efforts finds him sounding more like Zappa than Zeppelin; collaborating here with the former Can member, he's issued a single 25-minute track split over two sides of vinyl.

title: The Cost
label: Anti-
description: Irish band aims for the rafters on its latest shot at translating its big live show into a majestic album.

title: Abandoned Language
label: Ipecac
description: The consistently excellent and consistently underrated experimental hip-hop duo's dense compositions layer scores of tiny components into woozy, disorienting symphonies of noise.

title: The Magic Position
label: Loog
description: Shaking off the brooding insularity that clouded his previous records, Patrick Wolf goes upbeat, taking theatrical cues from Kate Bush, Antony, and Current 93 while finally overcoming his tendency toward sullen, adolescent introspection.

title: Ghosts of the Great Highway
label: Jetset
description: Ghosts of the Great Highway

title: Voices of Omens
label: Relapse
description: Arkansas metal band make doom that sounds multidimensional-- at once sludgy and epic.

title: Hats Off to the Buskers
label: Columbia
description: Another post-Libertines UK band, complete with jagged guitars, Northern accents, and at least one killer single.

title: Back Numbers
label: Zoe
description: Second full-length from the former Luna members and now married couple is again helmed by producer Tony Visconti and features covers of songs by Lee Hazlewood and Donovan, among others.

title: Songs III: Bird on the Water
label: Peacefrog
description: Backed by the revered Philly psych-folk group Espers-- and produced by that band's frontman, Greg Weeks-- singer-songwriter Marissa Nadler's latest outing is her best yet, ensconsing songs of sorrow in impressionistic phrases and careful musicianship.

title: Pocket Symphony
label: Astralwerks
description: Nicolas Godin and Jean-Benoît Dunckel's quietest and most austere offering could be one of the year's best-sounding records, but it'll also keep many of the band's pop fans at arm's length.

title: Brand New By Tomorrow
label: Brushfire
description: Former Grand Royal and Mo' Wax fixture continues to craft laidback, tuneful pop songs, again with help from producer Mario Caldato Jr.

title: Painted Garden
label: Birdman
description: Gris Gris leader gets more ambitious here than he was on his underrated solo debut, now applying his reverb-drenched vocals and sleepy timing to a range of musical styles.

title: Here Come the Waterworks
label: Hydra Head
description: Invaders comp stars and Hydra Head artists unleash mountain-sized, devastating riffs beneath lyrics almost entirely about disasters or the unnerving-- stampedes, lightning, ghosts, the coming freeze.

title: The Bird of Music
label: Moshi Moshi
description: On their sophomore effort, David Lynch's favorite synth-pop band continues to flirt with greatness, but again fails to deliver it.

title: Four Winds EP
label: Saddle Creek
description: Six-song EP finds Conor Oberst focusing on populist folk-rock in a noble attempt to record the troubles of the times and spark activism in an indifferent populace.

title: Summary
label: 5RC
description: Another 5RC record of monologue meta-indie from performance artist and musician Brendan Fowler.

title: Happy in Grey
label: Bpitch Control
description: Bpitch Control's promotion clerk gets her time behind the mic with a collaboration-filled set of scratchy IDM and soft house cuts.

title: The Deep Blue
label: Little Sister
description: Former Ash bassist continues to quietly deliver solid power-punk, outshining the recent work of her former fulltime group in the process.

title: The Foley Room
label: Ninja Tune
description: The Ninja Tune star has assembled his newest album-- his best in seven years-- as if he's decided he's exhausted the possibilities of musical instruments themselves and gone outside with a microphone to find out what sort of ambient sounds would make good beats.

title: Neon Bible
label: Merge
description: Neon Bible

title: Imaginary Volcano
label: Unsound
description: Former member of Bablicon and contributor to Olivia Tremor Control and Neutral Milk Hotel makes his solo debut.

title: Saunders Hollow
label: Camera Obscura
description: Florence-by-way-of-Virginia collective-- with assistance from Isobel Campbell-- run an idiosyncratic gamut, ranging from dreamy renaissance folk and refracted Americana to wide-scale improvised drones.

title: Heavy International
label: Aesthetics
description: This Chicago group once again crafts a seamless blending of dub, funk, and punk into a thick, hazy, immersive listen.

title: Live at the Bloomsbury Theatre, London
label: Rhino
description: Rod Argent and Colin Bluntstone prove they still have the chops and the voice as they move through each of their careers during this 2005 show.

title: Myth Takes
label: Warp
description: Nic Offer, now focused solely on this band after the unfortunate dismantling of Out Hud, hones in on what !!! do best-- create incendiary disco-punk raveups.

title: Love of Diagrams EP
label: Matador
description: Australian trio's dense rhythms and allusions to dub bring to mind Gang of Four and PiL, and then a Pylon cover seals the trans-oceanic post-punk deal.

title: It Is Becomes Disaffect Toward the Present World, Look Up the Sky!!
label: Emperor Jones
description: Despite the twee name, this Kentucky band swings between college-rock melancholia and low-key, shambolic country-rock.

title: Out of the Blue
label: Epic
description: Jeff Lynne's high-water mark-- a ridiculously heady orchestral pop record, with nods to disco and art-rock-- is given a deluxe reissue.

title: All Day
label: iTunes
description: Third entry in Nike's Original Run series-- 45-minute pieces meant to accompany the perfect workout-- comes courtesy of the Def Jux star.

title: Yours Truly, Angry Mob
label: Interscope
description: Universal's boy wonders follow their rowdy first record with one drenched in hungover introspection, with predictable results.

title: Yellow Swans & Birchville Cat Motel
label: Important
description: This two-track, album-length collaboration was recorded on stage and in a New Zealand studio, and it finds these two artists trading in their senses of dynamics for demonstrations of brute force.

title: Sex Change
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Latest from the Thrill Jockey vets nearly summarizes the band's career thus far, shining light on unmined and forgotten sounds and genres from the not-too-distant past but forgoing most of their less-advisable indulgences.

title: Modern Currencies
label: Paper Bag
description: Sophomore album from Toronto band is as loud and jagged as its predecessor but more varied in terms of songwriting, with welcome vocal contributions from ex-Hole/Smashing Pumpkins bassist Melissa Auf der Maur.

title: Chromophobia
label: Kompakt
description: Brazilian techno producer crafts one of the best artist albums in the Kompakt catalog.

title: Ultimate Gospel
label: Columbia
description: This career-spanning collection of the Man in Black's spiritual music mixes traditional works with the singer's own compositions and traces a complicated, decades-long struggle with temptation, damnation and salvation.

title: Los Valientes del Mundo Nuevo
label: Vice
description: Atlanta band seems to have found the ideal context for their brash, loud, and sloppy garage rock: live onstage in Tijuana, recorded by John Reis of Hot Snakes and Drive Like Jehu.

title: To Go Home
label: Merge
description: New single leads off with the terrific cover of Daniel Johnston's "To Go Home" found on last year's Post-War album then adds a Jimmie Dale Gilmore cover and two countrified Ward originals.

title: II
label: K-RAA-K
description: II

title: Greatest Hits
label: Capitol
description: Career overview from the Beastie Boys' first signing misses some key tracks but catches most of the highlights.

title: The Early Years
label: Beggars Banquet
description: The Early Years

title: White Flight
label: Range Life
description: Home-recorded epic by former Anniversary guitarist Justin Roelofs evades genre but ultimately suffers from lack of focus.

title: The Cavalry of Light EP
label: self-released
description: L.A.-based group's 2005 EP gets a reissue from Matador and Rough Trade, bringing to a wider audience this popular set of playful and ornate folk refreshments.

title: You, You're a History in Rust
label: Constellation
description: Broken Social Scene members Charles Spearin and Ohad Benchetrit return after a three-year silence with their latest outing as Constellation Records post-rock collective Do Make Say Think.

title: Euridice Proudhon / The Megafauna Undermined / Her Versus the Sad Cold Eventually
label: Kittridge
description: Euridice Proudhon / The Megafauna Undermined / Her Versus the Sad Cold Eventually

title: Jonny Greenwood Is the Controller
label: Sanctuary
description: Radiohead guitarist teams with Trojan Records for a reggae compilation heavy on 70s roots and dub, particularly the work of Lee "Scratch" Perry.

title: Dip
label: Melodic
description: Former Arab Strap member Aidan Moffat unveils his third record under his new full-time name-- now shortened from Lucky Pierre.

title: Play Pause Stop
label: Butter Problems
description: Mostly instrumental keyboard/drums duo made a mark on the jamband circuit and return for album number two with more focused songs and a greater diversity of instruments and textures.

title: Klick Revolution
label: Max Ernst
description: On the long-awaited follow-up to 2000's Klick, this highly conceptual glitch pioneer strips down his carnivalesque take on techno.

title: The Confessions Tour
label: Warner Bros.
description: Madonna's second live CD+DVD set in eight months, documenting a London show from her Confessions on a Dance Floor tour. Includes the infamous set-piece of Madonna performing on a cross, among other acts of self-aggrandizement.

title: In Advance of the Broken Arm
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Kill Rock Stars debut from this promising songwriter and remarkably distinctive and technically skilled guitar player also features Hella's Zach Hill on drums.

title: Like Drawing Blood
label: CVI
description: Melbourne-based producer Wally De Backer experiments with dub, sampledelica, and worldbeat textures not terribly far from Peter Gabriel, managing an Australian hit with "Learnalilgivinanlovin".

title: Daze on the Mounts
label: Family Vineyard
description: The reissue of this 2004 short-run, CD-only release finds the improv-pysch pioneer backed by Matt Valentine and Erika Elder and covering Love and J Mascis.

title: Dressed Up for the Letdown
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Secretly Canadian's lovable schlub returns with a more lushly-produced set of songs, equally marked by hopeless romanticism and bouts of despair.

title: Copia
label: Temporary Residence
description: Matthew Cooper crafts another record of ambient music that's music first and ambient second, with a good sense of pacing and structure.

title: Can't Go Back
label: Gnomonsong
description: Devendra Banhart and Andy Cabic's Gnomonsong label issues this delicate bedroom production, courtesy of Grizzly Bear/Beach House tourmate Jason Quever.

title: Slightly Sorry
label: Drag City
description: Former Tower Recordings member Patrick Gubler continues to explore MOR country-rock and fragile nods to British luminaries like Bert Jansch on his latest P.G. Six album.

title: Monsters of Dancehall: The Energy God
label: Greensleeves
description: This compilation focuses on the three Greensleeves albums that the former O'Neil Bryant recorded from 2000 to 2002, years when he was one of the most promising voices in Jamaican music.

title: Can Cladders
label: Drag City
description: Simplifying his arrangements while broadening his references to include blue-eyed soul, ska, and doo-wop, Sean O'Hagan has crafted the most enjoyable High Llamas record in years.

title: Grindstone
label: Rune Grammofon
description: Norwegian quartet follows its out-of-left-field In the Kingdom of Kitsch You Will Be a Monster with a record of more tightly plotted, ultra-extended dynamics and a stretch of chillier, loopier atmospherics. In other words, it's a whole lot weirder than its predecessor.

title: Super Roots 6/7/8
label: WEA
description: The second in Vice's Boredoms EP reissue campaign details the Japanese band's work from 1995 to 2000, when it shifted its sonic emphasis from zero-attention-span rock to meditation through repetition.

title: Phantom Parade
label: Social Registry
description: On his sophomore album, this Missouri-born, Brooklyn-based musician takes plenty of cues from electric bluesmen R.L. Burnside and Junior Kimbrough but folds in enough disparate bits to avoid devolving into blind homage.

title: Sharp Teeth
label: Fat Cat
description: Fat Cat artist distinguishes himself within the crowded field of post-Will Oldham indie-folk instrumentation and allegorical lyrics.

title: BBC in Session
label: Go! Discs
description: Seventeen tracks recorded for British radio offer a more raw and vibrant portrait of the myth-enshrouded Liverpool band than would emerge on its 1990 debut, making this compilation arguably the more essential document.

title: Are the Dark Horse
label: Jagjaguwar
description: After years of enjoying tangential connections to fellow Canadian indie rock stars Wolf Parade, Sunset Rubdown, and the Unicorns (RIP), this Jagjaguwar group is finally ready for its close-up.

title: Charlie Louvin
label: Tompkins Square
description: The surviving half of the Louvin Brothers releases his first proper solo album, which is made almost entirely of new recordings of old songs and features guest appearances by Jeff Tweedy, Will Oldham, George Jones, and Clem Snide's Eef Barzelay.

title: Say No to Being Cool - Say Yes to Being Happy
label: Modular
description: Former Incredible Moses Leroy leader Ron Fountenberry, along with one of his cohorts, starts again with this slice of soft-hearted, AAA indie pop.

title: Apron Strings
label: Di Cristina Stair
description: Second album from Stephen Cracknell's electro-folk outfit is more collaborative, featuring contributions from members of Hot Chip and Simian on a mixture of old English ballads, 70s covers, and originals.

title: A Crimson Grail (For 400 Electric Guitars)
label: Table of the Elements
description: The New York composer-- commissioned to create something special for Paris' all-night La Nuit Blanche festival-- crafts this three-part, larger-than-life sonic environment.

title: All of a Sudden I Miss Everyone
label: Temporary Residence
description: Austin-based post-rockers Explosions in the Sky stick too closely to their formula on their fourth full-length for Temporary Residence.

title: West
label: Lost Highway
description: West

title: Along the Quai
label: Team Love
description: This avant-pop duo's full-length Team Love debut hints at pan-culturalism and is carried by raw, rhythmic propulsion.

title: Blow it Up, Burn it Down, Kick it 'Til it Bleeds
label: Drag City
description: Project helmed by Stereolab bassist Simon Johns adds Mary Hampton on vocals and cranks up the rock, as the group leaves the mother band's orbit and creates its best record to date.

title: The Christ Tree
label: Dark Holler
description: Four-disc set collects the seldom heard and weirdly beautiful early-70s work of this freethinking Christian group, which imbued traditional liturgical pieces and original songs with imaginative arrangements using instruments from around the globe.

title: Ultimate Breaks & Beats: The Complete Collection
label: Street Beat
description: Street Beat offers all 174 tracks from the crucial Ultimate Breaks & Beats-- originally released in 25 volumes between 1986-91-- on two mp3 CDs, a collection that serves as a roadmap for the history and evolution of sample-era hip-hop.

title: Radio Amor
label: Mille Plateaux
description: Originally released on Mille Plateaux, the experimental electronic producer's second full-length under his own name and his coldest and most piercing work to date has been reissued by Alien 8.

title: Woke Myself Up
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Canadian singer/songwriter's latest album-- much of which constitutes a virtual reunion of her original band, Eric's Trip-- is yet another intimate affair with moments of homespun beauty.

title: Legendary Demo
label: Hydra Head
description: Ex-Cave In mastermind Adam McGrath and the rest of his proto-hipster metal band offers mouth-foaming, methed-out swagger.

title: Use Your Confusion
label: Amalgam Digital
description: Veteran underground hip-hop group adds a member (Queen Herawin), enlists some famous friends (including Slick Rick, Oh No, J-Zone, and Sadat X), and finally releases its long-awaited sophomore album.

title: Yearbook 1
label: Information
description: Swedish duo finally makes its CD debut, exploring the trance-inducing repetition of Manuel Göttsching, the gossamer lyricism of Durutti Column, and rhythms that allude to Can and Bill Laswell's Sacred System.

title: CD86: 48 Tracks from the Birth of Indie Pop
label: Castle
description: This 2xCD collection of shambling, mid-80s indie pop-- featuring Jesus & Mary Chain, the Pastels, the Shop Assistants, the Wedding Present, Primal Scream, and Talulah Gosh, among others-- was compiled by Saint Etienne's Bob Stanley and released to coincide with the 20th anniversary of C86.

title: Learn to Sing Like a Star
label: Yep Roc
description: The Throwing Muses/50FootWave leader's self-produced seventh album-- and first for Yep Roc-- eschews the tangled goth-pop aesthetic of her previous imprint, 4AD.

title: Casually Smashed to Pieces
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Latest album from the 90s post-rock/math-rock band refines the sound of its high-water mark, Everywhere and Right Here.

title: Paralyzed Dance, Tonight
label: Narnack
description: This group's second album-- and first as a duo-- is a ramshackle folk record that draws from both 1960s Greenwich Village and Celtic traditions.

title: London Is the Place for Me: Part Four
label: Honest Jon's
description: Subtitled African Dreams and the Piccadilly High Life, the latest installment in this wonderful series-- issued by Damon Albarn's Honest Jon's label-- features Caribbean calypso, kwela from Southern Africa, and West African highlife.

title: Full Bloom
label: Eastern Developments
description: Former Black Dice drummer Hisham Bharoocha lightens up and crafts a nice summation/meditation/thesis on where the 1990s hardcore thing has flopped down in the 21st century.

title: The Bird and the Bee
label: Blue Note
description: Blue Note issues the debut album from this jazz-inflected electro-acoustic duo.

title: Arrogance
label: No Fun
description: The laptop improviser's first release on his own imprint, No Fun Productions, finds him playing with analog equipment and crafting what comes across as the darker, droning, depressive counterpart to his 2005 LP Welcome Home.

title: Sweet Beliefs
label: Ever
description: In 2003, this French foursome's debut, Spring, cracked Pitchfork's year-end top 50. This, their first album since the implosion of their (and M83's) former label Gooom, finds them remaining true to their space-rock roots.

title: Imagine the Shapes
label: What's Your Rupture?
description: New York boutique label What's Your Rupture? collects its first few vinyl singles and EPs, including releases by Love Is All, the Long Blondes, caUSE co-MOTION!, and Comet Gain.

title: Lifetime
label: Fueled by Ramen
description: Released on a label run by Fall Out Boy's Pete Wentz, this is the emocore pioneers' first new album in a decade and it catches the band fairly close to its late-period shine, though coupled with the wisdom (and differences) of age.

title: 8-Bit Operators: The Music of Kraftwerk
label: Astralwerks
description: The canonical krautrock band, covered by artists wielding Nintendo Gameboys, Commodore 64s, and other lo-res electronics.

title: The Definitive Rock Collection
label: Rhino
description: Rhino offers a single-disc serving of the best of the ragged and defiantly rough-hewn blues-rock band that transformed drunk and sloppy into unlikely compliments.

title: The Postmarks
label: Unfiltered
description: Miami trio crafts urbane indie pop that echoes the Softies, Françoise Hardy, and Sunflower-era Brian Wilson.

title: Conqueror
label: Hydra Head
description: Metal legend Justin Broadrick (Godflesh, Napalm Death) issues his second full-length of heavy shoegaze, drawing equally from Slowdive, Red House Painters, and doom metal gloom.

title: Strength in Numbers
label: Beggars
description: Strength in Numbers

title: Law
label: Layered
description: A year after its UK release, Milwaukee-based instrumentalists' debut hits the U.S., full to the brim with digitally precise percussive landscapes and mesmerizing acoustic ballads.

title: The Ruby Suns
label: Memphis Industries
description: Memphis Industries issues the promising but spotty debut by Ryan McPhun's Pet Sounds-inspired septet.

title: Settle Down City
label: Jade Tree
description: Former members of Breather Resist come together over sludgy bass and noisy, brittle guitars, riffing on influences including the Jesus Lizard and June of 44.

title: New Magnetic Wonder
label: Yep Roc
description: The Apples in Stereo's first album since 2002's The Velocity of Sound continues Robert Schneider's superficial debt to ELO's late-70s prog-pop.

title: Direction Reaction Creation / Hit Parade
label: Polydor
description: Direction Reaction Creation / Hit Parade

title: Fur & Gold
label: Caroline
description: The expressive voice of Natasha Khan struggles to elevate this Brighton band's dramatic and goth-tinged debut above Ren Faire silliness.

title: Revolt Music
label: UgExplode
description: Flying Luttenbachers mastermind and Lake of Dracula member, among other projects, here returns to his roots in improvised jazz.

title: Phantom Punch
label: Astralwerks
description: The Norwegian romantic follows through on his promise/threat to toughen his sound by placing his vibrant melodies behind a veneer of modern indie rock.

title: The Projected Passion Revue
label: Mercury
description: Collecting everything recorded by the tight, ultra-disciplined 1981 version of this criminally underrated band, this comp features three singles, a live set, and a BBC session.

title: Monolith
label: Audio Dregs
description: Monolith

title: The Amber Gatherers
label: Drag City
description: Scottish folk-rock singer-songwriter addresses human frailty and manmade failure, frequently coupling complex internal and external rhymes and commanding expansive mythological and geographical vocabularies.

title: Music for Total Chickens
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Asthmatic Kitty genre-wanderer Rafter Roberts offers a hodge-podge of short, flitting, moody rock experiments.

title: Retrospektiv
label: Kemado
description: This Swedish art collective is Kemado's iciest outfit yet, coming across like a less rhythmically inhibited Joy Division-- all choppily deliberate guitar and synthetic yowl.

title: Leaving the Nest
label: Domino
description: Domino-signed D.C. bartender blends a natural optimism into tracks about bummed-out circumstances, making his songs seem uplifting even when they're about defeat.

title: Yes, I'm a Witch
label: Astralwerks
description: The legendary vocalist, songwriter, and performer has her career re-examined by artists such as Cat Power, Spirtualized, Antony, and Le Tigre.

title: Some Beans & an Octopus
label: Sonig
description: Sounding unlike anything else Adam Butler's released under the banner of Vert, this record finds the experimental electronic producer trying his hand at vocal-based pop.

title: Marginalia
label: Brah
description: Side project of Oneida frontman Bobby Matador and his partner Erica Fletcher avoids the parent band's extended psych jams in favor of low-key, easygoing songcraft.

title: Odori
label: Hefty
description: Strong debut from Japanese composer Hirohito Ihara uses piano and subtle electronics to evoke a stark, wintry atmosphere where his dreamy compositions flow toward quiet epiphanies.

title: Loney, Noir
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop debut from Emil Svanängen, the latest in a now long line of breakthrough Swedish indie pop performers, is another take on sensitivity, earnest romanticism, and stubborn optimism.

title: Forever Changing: The Golden Age of Elektra Records 1963-1973
label: Elektra
description: This 5xCD set chronicles Jac Holzman and Paul Rickholt's label's heyday and features selections by Love, the Stooges, the Doors, the Lovin' Spoonful, the Incredible String Band, Phil Ochs, and Tim Buckley, among many others.

title: Volk
label: Mute
description: Latest from the influential industrialists puts forth bent, politically charged, and ultimately ham-fisted adaptations of national anthems.

title: Secrets From the Clockhouse
label: Creeping Bent
description: Soup Dragons and Telstar Ponies member Sushil K Dade invites indie and experimental heavyweights such as Thurston Moore, Kim Gordon, Stuart Murdoch, and Damo Suzuki to his latest Future AKA project, a referential and reverential celebration of 1960s folk rock.

title: In Stormy Nights
label: Drag City
description: Masaki Batoh and his enigmatic Japanese collective offer its first new album since its majestic 2004 prog-epic Hypnotic Underworld.

title: National Anthem of Nowhere
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Broken Social Scene guitarist Andrew Whiteman's latest is at once straight-laced and funky in the way that only indie rock can be.

title: A Weekend in the City
label: Vice
description: Roughly two years after their dynamic debut Silent Alarm, Bloc Party are no less earnest and deadly serious, but no less in charge of their craft either.

title: Offshore
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Frontman Daniel Burton and his band-- which includes members of Windsor for the Derby, Unwed Sailor, and On Fillmore-- built this 38-minute LP around their previously released, eight-minute track "Offshore".

title: Exploding Demon
label: MT6
description: Baltimore band echoes Excepter's psychedelic qualities and love of echo, reverb, and vocals buried in the mix until they're another undulating component of the overall swaying noise.

title: New Young Pony Club EP
label: Modular
description: Less a punk band dabbling in synthesizers and hi-hat than a dance act employing rock tropes when appropriate, this London group adds welcomes doses of danger and sloppiness to its disco-guitar sound.

title: Afro Samurai: The Soundtrack
label: Koch
description: This soundtrack-- for a starkly bloody but undoubtedly bad ass cartoon-- was crafted by RZA and features appearances by Talib Kweli, GZA, Q-Tip, Big Daddy Kane, and, uh, the Bobby Digital character.

title: Endless Highway: The Music of the Band
description: To celebrate the 30th anniversary of the filming of landmark concert film The Last Waltz, Sony Legacy gathers the Allman Brothers, My Morning Jacket, Death Cab for Cutie, Roseanne Cash, Lee Ann Womack, and others for a tribute to the Band.

title: We Died They Remixed
label: Inertia
description: The Australian indie pop band-- who've included at least one remix on each of its singles/EPs to date-- here enlist Hot Chip, Safety Scissors, DAT Politics, and others to transform selections from 2005's In Case We Die.

title: I Can't Go On, I'll Go On
label: Merge
description: The Merge power pop band is revealed to be confidently inventive and assured despite working within the framework of a typically conservative subgenre.

title: Vain, Erudite, and Stupid: Selected Works 1987-2005
label: Ba Da Bing!
description: This lengthy 2xCD set compiles the best of almost two decade's worth of ramshackle, half-speed, and scary New Zealand-made racket.

title: RoadKillOvercoat
label: Epitaph
description: The distinctive Epitaph MC offers the slowest, weirdest, and least complacent record of his uncompromising career.

title: Super Roots 1/3/5
label: WEA
description: Super Roots 1/3/5

title: Dance and Walk
label: Muskel
description: London-based duo craft primitive, melody-deficient synth-punk whose sinister pulse and anarchic, amateurish quality give off an impression of on-the-spot composition.

title: Ghost Is Not Real
label: Catskills
description: Second album from Finnish indie poppers is darker and moodier than its predecessor, as leader Marko Nyberg balances atmosphere with Reeta-Leena Korhola's delicate voice and folky tendencies.

title: There's No 666 in Outer Space
label: Ipecac
description: Spencer Seim and Zach Hill's shapeshifting unit records its first album for Ipecac, and here their once freeform compositions tend to concede more readily to conventional rock structures.

title: Vegas: Live
label: Rhino
description: Comprising four CDs and one DVD of previously unreleased live material, covering three decades, from The Sands, Caesars Palace and The Golden Nugget; the King of Las Vegas on his home turf.

title: Lon Gisland EP
label: Ba Da Bing!
description: This five-track, 16-minute EP-- which features four new tracks, plus a full-band remake of "Scenic World"-- demonstrates that, yes, there are songs behind Zach Condon's much-discussed international flavors.

title: Finally
label: Chapter
description: Chapter compiles the best of this singer-songwriter-- perhaps most widely known for her "Come Here", which featured in Before Sunset-- who can be filed alongside other recent reissue stars Karen Dalton, Judee Sill, and Catherine Howe.

title: Find Shelter
label: Plain
description: The producer of Joanna Newsom's The Milk-Eyed Mender-- who's also worked on recent efforts by Devendra Banhart, Bert Jansch, and Vetiver-- makes his solo debut.

title: The Roots of Dubstep
label: Tempa
description: Compiled by our own Martin Clark and issued by Tempa, this compilation does what it says on the tin: traces the development and history of dubstep.

title: Ed Rec Vol. 1
label: Vice
description: French dance label Ed Banger-- home of Justice, DJ Mehdi, SebastiAn, and Uffie, among others-- collects its hits and misses on its first ever retrospective compilation.

title: Cryptograms
label: Kranky
description: This Atlanta five-piece's shimmering Kranky debut is alternately murky and ethereal, drawing equal influence from classic shoegaze, early Factory Records LPs, and the enigmatic ambient recordings with which it shares a label, shifting between impressionistic, reverb-saturated reverie and psych-heavy pop gems.

title: Trouble Everywhere
label: This Generation Tapes
description: Former OnAirLibrary! and Boggs members fluff up their previous bands' more experimental sounds with the help of Amanda Garrett and Claudia Deheza's ethereal vocals.

title: Is That the Tralala
label: Audika
description: On their sophomore outing, this Brooklyn band layers energetic vocal harmonies over sugary punk and sings about young love in the city and the occasional topical concern.

title: Rise Up
artist: Thomas Mapfumo and the Blacks Unlimited
label: Calabash Music
description: Exiled Zimbabwean, based for several years in Eugene, Oregon, delivers politically charged songs that lift spirits while railing against injustice.

title: Stones Throw: Ten Years
label: Stones Throw
description: This retrospective focuses on the unexplored margins of the Stones Throw catalog, foregoing more obvious selections for odd asides from Quasimoto, Madvillain, Koushik, and others.

title: Some Loud Thunder
label: Clap Your Hands Say Yeah
description: In the past two years, this proto-Web 2.0 band has seen the myth of its self-made success eclipse the music contained on its still-fantastic debut. The band responded by enlisting producer Dave Fridmann to help shape a sophomore effort that, once again, it's quietly nudging into the marketplace.

title: My Heart Has a Wish That You Would Not Go
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Scottish genre-sifters known for their dark, brooding atmospheres return with an album of soft-hearted string and pianos, and a fair share of ominous drumscapes.

title: Noon & Eternity
artist: To Live and Shave in L.A.
label: Menlo Park
description: Veteran avant-rock band-- which counts Andrew WK and Don Fleming among its members-- returns with a swampy, slow, queasy record that hearkens back to the nascent days of no wave.

title: Fizheuer Zieheuer
label: Playhouse
description: Already known for crafting long, minimalist tracks, the Chilean-German producer here stretches his modus operandi to the limit, offering a 37-minute single, plus a 36-minute CD-only remix.

title: The Peel Sessions
label: Island
description: Twenty-nine tracks commissioned for the legendary BBC Radio 1 Show, tracing Jarvis Cocker's long, quixotic journey from early 1980s schoolboy anguish to mid-90s acclaim to 21st century post-Britpop rehab.

title: Raising Your Voice…Trying to Stop an Echo
label: Darla
description: Blissed out duo makes ambient music reminiscent of non-ambient yet shimmering artists such as Sigur Rós and Slowdive.

title: Continental 62
label: Smells Like
description: Again collaborating with Sonic Youth's Lee Ranaldo-- who lends guitar and backing vocals to a couple of these tracks-- the Madrid/New York-based musician offers her third (mostly) English-language LP.

title: Atlantis: Hymns for Disco
label: EMI
description: Canadian MC follows his genre-blending, award-winning sophomore album Joyful Rebellion with a conceptual piece, a melodious corrective to two-plus years of ostensible media falsities about its author.

title: Living Well
label: Temporary Residence
description: The singer from Pinback (along with plenty of other projects) crafts a solo album that echoes the pristine, nearly mathematical precision pop of his most well known band.

title: Unifying Themes Redux / 061502
label: Hydra Head
description: Unifying Themes Redux / 061502

title: People EP
label: Fat Cat
description: This four-song EP features two versions of its title track-- one recorded in the studio, another recorded live-- plus a Feels-like ballad and a vocal effects-laden piece.

title: Ancestral Songs
label: Holy Mountain
description: The Lungfish leader here builds acoustic raga that conjures a vast nexus of hell, heaven, demons, angels, man, and all the overlaps in between.

title: Diwan 2
label: Wrasse
description: The sequel to the multi-faceted Algerian star's 1998 album sets aside Western pop to focus on cover songs delivered in traditional North African styles.

title: Coastal
label: Table of the Elements
description: San Agustin leader creates a pedals-and-processors solo album on which simple sources are electronically bent into anomalous but congruent layers and drones.

title: A Life Less Lived: The Gothic Box
label: Rhino
description: Rhino compiles an impressive collection of the oft-maligned and misunderstood genre of goth-rock, which includes selections from a wide variety of artists, among them Joy Division, the Cure, Bauhaus, Siouxsie & the Banshees, the Misfits, Sisters of Mercy, Throbbing Gristle, Ministry, Mission UK, and Einstürzende Neubauten.

title: Hissing Fauna, Are You the Destroyer?
label: Polyvinyl
description: Of Montreal's darkest and most experimental record to date, Hissing Fauna, Are You the Destroyer gorily chronicles frontman Kevin Barnes' recent relationship woes, all while rebuilding the band as a mechanical synth-pop/glam hybrid.

title: Song Cyclops Volume Two
label: Parasol
description: Unreleased material originally recorded in 1999 is now issued as a sequel to the band's 2000 concept record, yielding a fair number of lo-fi, 60s-obsessed pop gems.

title: Taiga
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Latest from the band led by Boredoms drummer Yoshimi P-We is their broadest, busiest, and furthest reaching album to date, which oddly enough leads to some problems.

title: Still Point of Turning
label: Bubble Core
description: This Philly four-piece has been called shoegazers, but the group seems to craft songs first and arrive at their eventual sound through a more circuitous route.

title: Rites of Uncovering
label: Thrill Jockey
description: For its second album of Big Sky psychedelia, this Thrill Jockey band crafts a more group-led effort that features some of the most engaging, impressive guitar solos in recent memory.

title: Friend Opportunity
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Deerhoof follow their excellent The Runners Four with another turn away from hyper-complex pop and no wave, and toward accessible, foot-stomping rock.

title: Eingya
label: Type
description: Keith Kenniff's third album of hazy ambience (and second as Helios) balances washed-out electronic processing with clear guitar melodies and delicate piano.

title: Never Hear the End of It
label: Yep Roc
description: The Nova Scotian power pop band offers a pleasant surprise-- this 30-track LP is its best since 1999's Between the Bridges.

title: Pop Ambient 2007
label: Kompakt
description: The latest edition of Kompakt's annual ambient series is among its best, featuring contributions from Wolfgang Voigt's Gas project, as well as Markus Guentner, the Field, and Ulf Lohmann.

title: Tones of Town
label: Memphis Industries
description: Sunderland band and Futureheads pals follow their understated 2005 self-titled debut with another record of baroque indie pop, time signature changes, and clever hooks.

title: Wincing the Night Away
label: Sub Pop
description: James Mercer & co. aim to deflect the inevitable Brafflash by crafting a more texturally diverse record than their outstanding, if uncomplicated, previous outings.

title: ...Things From Inside Your Body
label: Black Velvet Fuckere
description: Career-spanning compilation of an Indiana-based group that only existed between 1993 and 1995 and today sounds like a proto-Lightning Bolt.

title: We Know About the Need
label: Anticon
description: Hood's Chris Adams continues his turn toward glitchy hip-hop with this Anticon-issued, dubstep-infused solo LP.

title: The Return to Form Black Majick Party
label: Ninja Tune
description: This Liverpool-based artist-- a member of Ninja Tune Krautrock jammers Super Numeri and a touring bassist/remixer for Ladytron-- remakes himself as a T. Rex obsessive on his debut solo LP.

title: 1,039/Smoothed Out Slappy Hours/Kerplunk
label: Lookout!
description: Reprise revisits the Bay Area punk band's pre-Dookie, get-in-the-van days with reissues of its two Lookout! albums.

title: Fuzzy Warbles Collector’s Album
label: Ape House Ltd.
description: Four years in the making, this generous 9xCD set compiles the recent home recordings of the prolific XTC leader, with tracks ranging from the singer-songwriter laughing or leaving an answering machine message to some of the best material he's ever written.

title: There to Here
label: Dischord
description: Fugazi bassist works with pals including Guy Picciotto, Ian MacKaye, and Amy Farina of the Evens to create a collection of stripped-down tunes heavy on political content.

title: We Are All From Somewhere Else
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Chicago Underground veteran Rob Mazurek heads this 14-piece, all-star group, which features many of the key figures in the Chicago avant-jazz scene (including Tortoise's John McEntire, Jeff Parker, and John Herndon) and is releasing its debut LP on Thrill Jockey.

title: Universal Indians
label: Orange Twin
description: This Orange Twin Southern rock collective, headed by Jim McHugh and spiritually guided by free-jazz saxophonist Albert Ayler, features nearly 30 musicians seemingly playing at the same time.

title: The Moonstation House Band
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Young Chicago-based multi-instrumentalist channels the riffs and delivery of T.Rex on his ambitious, but not quite consistent, Secretly Canadian debut.

title: Friend and Foe
label: Barsuk
description: Following through on the potential of their outstanding debut, I Am the Fun Blame Monster, Portland, Ore.-based Menomena craft beautifully arranged modular pop out of improvised loops, creating the first great indie rock record of the new year.

title: Early Violence
label: Social Registry
description: Promising indie rock band follows its debut LP, Dins, with a set of tracks collected from vinyl-only EPs.

title: Together With Cats
label: Exit Stencil
description: With his murky arrangements, overlapping falsettos, and sinister little slides into a nasal vibrato, this young singer-songwriter owes a clear debt to early Devendra Banhart and Iron & Wine.

title: The Aquarium
label: Dischord
description: Debut by this unusual addition to the Dischord label roster is a sugary pop rush, trading in humor and nostalgia as it tempers heavier tracks with nods to maligned genres like synth metal.

title: Here & Now
label: Sony
description: Yes, that America. The band best known for "The Horse With No Name" returns with a late-career reunion album, getting assistance here from My Morning Jacket, Ryan Adams, James Iha (Smashing Pumpkins), and Adam Schlesinger (Fountains of Wayne), among others.

title: Rainbow
label: Drag City
description: The Japanese trio collaborates with fellow countryman and seminal psych guitarist Kurihara to dabble in shoegaze, lounge weirdness, toy-box balladry, and moody, stringed pyrotechnics.

title: Vietnam
label: Kemado
description: After a dense and dirge-laden EP, Brooklyn's Vietnam take a more inviting turn as they pepper their debut full-length with surprisingly lush and tender country-soul.

title: Azioni
label: Die Schachtel
description: This 2xCD/DVD of previously unreleased music celebrates the work of legendary film composer Ennio Morricone's improvisational 1960s collective.

title: The Enemy Chorus
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Secretly Canadian's transcontinental neo-pysch group adds krautrock sprawl to its kitchen-sink approach.

title: How Low Can You Go? / I Belong to This Band
label: Dust-to-Digital
description: How Low Can You Go? / I Belong to This Band

title: The Evolution
label: LaFace
description: The so-called princess of crunk & b follows her excellent debut, Goodies, with a sophomore album bloated by spoken-word interludes and boilerplate pop.

title: Harpooner
label: Scarlet Shame
description: Indie singer-songwriter buffs and shines his tracks with a surplus of studio tinkering.

title: Silver & Fire
description: Australian singer-songwriter's neglected debut is an inventive meandering through folk tempered with poetic geography lessons.

title: An Aural Symbiotic Mystery
label: Sub Rosa
description: On their first-ever issued collaboration, improv legends Tony Conrad and Charlemagne Palestine happen upon one of the most inspired releases of either of their careers.

title: Mass Appeal: The Best of Gang Starr
label: Virgin
description: Guru and DJ Premier's second best-of record is a single-disc, hour-long submersion into the group's dusty warmth, as well as a DVD of videos.

title: The Good, the Bad & the Queen
artist: The Good, the Bad & the Queen
label: Virgin
description: Damon Albarn's latest extra-curricular project is a supergroup featuring Paul Simonon (the Clash), Simon Tong (the Verve), and legendary Afrobeat percussionist Tony Allen. Together, the quartet create a downcast set of politcally aware songs that reflects the mood of life in the UK during wartime.

title: Remixed and Reimagined
label: Legacy
description: The legendary singer and songwriter has her already diverse, malleable career remixed by artists such as Coldcut, Francois K, and DJ Logic.

title: Deliver Me From My Enemies
label: Grove Music
description: The final album from the biblically minded deep roots trilogy the reggae producer cut in the mid-1970s-- reissued here by Blood & Fire, with bonus tracks-- found him adding lovers rock to his repertoire.

title: Kamehameha
label: Creative Capitalism
description: Spazzy art rockers from Baltimore use peppy surf guitar and chaotic drumming to underscore vocalist Molly Sigel's baffling array of preverbal cries.

title: Kitsuné Maison 3
label: Kitsuné
description: Venerable French label series takes another turn toward electro-rock, here offering selections from not only Simian Mobile Disco, Digitalism, and Freeform Five but Klaxons, the Gossip, and Oh No! Oh My! as well.

title: Someone to Drive You Home
label: Rough Trade
description: Style and wit color this Sheffield group's long-awaited debut LP, a kitchen-sink exploration of fear and desire that's reminiscent of Pulp's breakthrough record, His 'n' Hers.

title: Starless & Bible Black
label: Locust
description: Debut album from a Manchester trio that creates music from within the progressive British folk-rock tradition of Pentangle and Fairport Convention.

title: Ecdysis
label: Ryko
description: After collaborating with Gorillaz and Beck guitarist Smokey Hormel, the former Cibo Matto singer finally unveils her first solo album, and it plays like something of a career-retrospective mash-up

title: Chokes! EP
label: 12XU
description: Originally intended as part of a full-length before the 2005 death of drummer Michael Dahlquist, Chokes! gathers Silkworm's final recordings and serves as a powerful end to the band's career.

title: Ten Years of Tears
label: Vital
description: Career-capping compilation from the now-defunct Scottish duo is a pleasingly sloppy amalgamation of singles, B-sides, and unreleased tracks that convincingly demonstrates the enduring power of Arab Strap's bleak vision.

title: 100 Lbs
label: Phono
description: Matthew Herbert's 1996 collection of early dancefloor-oriented 12"s is reissued and packaged with an eight-track bonus disc comprised of B-sides and unreleased tracks recorded from 1995 to 2000.

label: Plug Research
description: IDM-influenced sounds from this talented architect of instrumental hip-hop.

title: World Waits
label: Reincarnate
description: Former Sunny Day Real Estate leader shows a new taste for restraint on his latest solo album, which, like the recent Guillemots effort, is sophisticated adult pop with some prog kicking around the edges.

title: Dear Sir EP
label: Le Grand Magistery
description: Detroit septet's courage to experiment keeps them sounding fresh, as they veer from krautrock jams to Kinks-inspired pop and raise the stakes for their upcoming full-length debut.

title: No Place to Be
label: Sony
description: The fratboy and magazine editors' reggae star of choice gets assistance from Sly & Robbie and Bill Laswell on his new EP, which comes packaged with a live DVD.

title: Endless Summer
label: Mego
description: Newly mixed reissue of the modern classic-- an experimental electronic record that uses digital bits to refract and bend ideas about warmth in pop music-- features two bonus cuts, including a previously unreleased track.

title: Parasiticide
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Sherry Fraser's long-running but low-output rock outfit returns with another set of blunt, (deliberately) awkward, sometimes arresting music.

title: Working Nine to Wolf
label: Lovitt
description: Post-grunge indie band aims to take classic riffs and stretch and tease them until they feel graceful and epic.

title: Déformation Professionnelle
label: Staubgold
description: Polish-born and Cologne-based producer takes an economical approach to experimental electronic music, creating miniatures in sound.

title: Dynamite! Dancehall Style
label: Soul Jazz
description: The unparalleled Soul Jazz follows its fantastic, cross-generational Jamaican primer series with a dancehall-focused sequel.

title: Disco Romance
label: Paper Bag
description: Songwriter/producer Johan Agebjörn and his publicity-shy Swedish muse resurrect Italo disco as a vehicle for deeply nostalgic and melancholic Swedish indie pop, resulting in a eloquent, auspicious debut album.

title: Julie Doiron and the Wooden Stars
label: Tree
description: "Anyone is pretty when she smiles; me, I'm only pretty when I cry," sings Julie Doiron on her new album. And I'll be damned if you don't just want to hold her, and maybe spend the whole day curled up under a blanket with her, staring out the window at the grey Canadian winter. A solid dose of comforting, resolute melancholy can be good for the soul sometimes, and despite being the most upbeat album of Doiron's musical oeuvre (thanks in part to having a real backing band this time out), Julie Doiron and the Wooden Stars still delivers the 100% RDA.Like Bettie Serveert's Carol van Dijk without the sunny smiles, Beth Orton without the reverb chamber and the Chemical Brothers connection, or Jenny Toomey on Xanax, Doiron has a natural ache in her voice that manages to sidestep both wistful whimsy and wretched despair. Her previous solo work seemed to be a bit too stark and four-tracky to distinguish itself from the rest of the already-saturated mope-rock market; here, she teams up with fellow Canadians the Wooden Stars to create a much warmer, more fully developed sound which supports her vocal timbre a bit better. There are still plenty of beautiful downbeat moments, like "The Longest Winter" ("Not even the prank calls/ Are helping pass the time anymore") or "Seven." But it's also surprisingly pleasant to hear Doiron fit herself into slightly different clothes, such as on the perky, almost Cardigans-like "Dance Music" and the stiff, insistent bounce of "The Best Thing for Me."Although eleven songs and 42 minutes long, Julie Doiron and the Wooden Stars still seems a bit slight. Maybe it's because it's a rather easy, effortless listen, albeit something you'd only put in your stereo once in a while. But like hot chocolate on a cold night, it has its proper time and place.

title: Matt and Kim
label: IHeartComix
description: Synth/drum new wave duo from Brooklyn combines snotty vocals, scattershot drumming, and anthemic choruses in an attempt to soundtrack your next party.

title: The Manhattan Love Suicides
label: Magic Marker
description: Leeds quartet looks toward twee while cutting tender pop sentiments with violent guitar noise, evoking the Jesus and Mary Chain and retro noise-poppers like the Raveonettes.

title: Plays Pajama Pop Pour Vous
label: Audio Dregs
description: Imaginative, spare, and decidedly cute pop from the America-born, Japan-based producer Shawn James Seymour and whispery vocalist Yoshimi Tomida.

title: Creepshow
label: Slender Means Society
description: Five-track, limited-edition EP marries Liz Harris' chilly drone to Xiu Xiu's balladry, as the participants explore a petite palette.

title: Live from Austin, TX: Austin City Limits
label: New West
description: The rich-voiced singer takes her combination of cred and rootsy traditionalism to the venerable PBS-show stage.

title: The Silent Years
label: No Alternative
description: Debut album from this highly melodic Detroit indie rock band features a series of fine hooks arranged with a collective ear toward nuance and breathing space.

title: Green Blues
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: As they did on the recent 2xCD Mother of Thousands, Matthew Valentine and Erika Elder continue to abandon overt folk gestures in favor of heavier, more electric space-blues on this, their Ecstatic Peace debut.

title: You Are the Pride of Your Street EP
label: Soundsister
description: Mexican electronic producer Ángel Sánchez focuses on songcraft and his androgynous, rich vocals on his latest project, which is named for a Cocteau Twins song and features a Will Oldham cover.

title: Adventura Anatomica
label: Semishugure
description: Live album from the Norwegian singer and sound artist documents a fairytale-themed multimedia performance that found her layering sounds derived from her voice and body to startling effect.

title: Complete A and B Sides 1963-1970
label: Eclipse
description: This set from Springfield's most fertile period collects her UK A-sides on one disc and the B-sides on another, with fantastic songs spread almost equally across both.

title: Wishbone
label: Light in the Attic
description: Light in the Attic continues its Jamaica to Toronto series by unearthing this reggae/soul/funk gem from the Skatalites, Soul Vendors, and Sound Dimension organist.

title: In Circles
label: Quarterstick
description: Seamlessly mixing tape loops and electronic effects into her stark and rustic songs, the former Rodan bassist releases one of her finest solo albums.

title: Skull Alcoholic: The Complete Solar Anus
label: Tumult
description: The complete discography of this obscure Japanese psych-rock band is collected on two discs, from its 1997 debut to its final record in 2000. At the group's best, it fused doomy metallic sludge, airy solos, and neo-tribal rhythms.

title: Sing the Greys
label: Hits the Fan
description: On its frequently excellent debut, this Glaswegian band-- like early Delgados or BMX Bandits before them-- reflects its city's love of rough-edged, unpolished indie rock.

title: True Magic
label: Geffen
description: Latest from the should-have-been hip-hop star is rumored to be a deal-closer with Geffen, and from its bare packaging to its idle rhymes, it feels like one.

title: She's Mature
label: Free News
description: Philly crew brings the snark on the full-length follow-up to its Thug Paradise 2.1 EP, both parodying and celebrating an array of hip-hop styles while also managing to lock down a Ghostface cameo.

title: Skeleton Blues
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Simon Joyner's 10th proper album is among his noisiest and most accessible, as he allows his backing band to inflate his typically sparse narratives with unruly rock dynamism.

title: Something About Violins
label: Western Vinyl
description: A spare debut that brings to mind early Cat Power and Julie Doiron, with a lo-fi sound that compliments its dark subject matter.

title: 28 Later
label: Lo
description: Bernard Fevre, the mysterious French DJ behind Black Devil's seminal 1978 Disco Club EP, returns 28 years later for an encore.

title: Candylion
label: Rough Trade
description: Merry pranksterism and ruminations on more serious subjects co-mingle on the Super Furry Animals singer's second solo album.

title: Breathless
label: Sonic Boomerang
description: Debut by the new band from former Hurricane Lamps frontman Eric Tischler captures the jagged songcraft of vintage Who in an economical trio format.

title: If We Can't Escape My Pretty
label: New West
description: After debuting under singer Nic Armstrong's name, this Austin-by-way-of-Nottingham outfit returns with a more varied collection of psych-tinged blues-rock and guitar pop.

title: I Stand Alone
label: Anti-
description: Veteran folkie and Woody Guthrie protégé enlists the help of Lucinda Williams, Corin Tucker, Nels Cline, and Flea on his new album and first since 1999's The Long Ride.

title: KTL
label: Editions Mego
description: Sunn0))) guitarist Stephen O'Malley teams with electronic noisenik and Mego label boss Peter "Pita" Rehberg to provide the score for Kindertotenlieder, a theatrical collaboration between French performance artist Gisele Vienne and American novelist Dennis Cooper that will debut in March.

title: Ghost Reveries [Special Edition]
label: Roadrunner
description: Ghost Reveries [Special Edition]

title: The Fountain OST
label: Nonesuch
description: Ex-Pop Will Eat Itself member Clint Mansell again crafts the soundtrack to Darren Aronofsky's latest film, this time with help from the famed Scottish post-rock band.

title: Sexor
label: Last Gang
description: Veteran producer, DJ, and remixer finally issed his debut LP this year, and it features collaborations with Jake Shears and Soulwax as well as covers of Public Enemy and Nine Inch Nails.

title: Shine Through
label: Stones Throw
description: On his Stones Throw-released debut LP, this SoCal musician blends salsa, broken beats, hip-hop, and 70s-style soul into an optimistic, effervescent piece of bedroom studio miscellany.

title: Entomology
label: Domino
description: The hugely influential Postcard group is now properly available in the U.S. for the first time on a 22-track anthology with selections from singles, Peel Sessions, and its original, abandoned, debut album.

title: Hip Hop Is Dead
label: Def Jam
description: No, it's not Illmatic, but here Nasir Jones is again telling stories, attacking the mic, and displaying his virtuosity.

title: Funnel Cloud
label: Nettwerk
description: More stabs at painstaking beauty and emotional heft-- and detours into countrypolitan-- from this dramatic indie pop band.

title: Words Are Dead
label: Lucky Madison
description: This Portland, Ore. duo have been racking up Iron & Wine comparisons but there's something a bit more avant going on beneath its rustic façade.

title: Connectivity!
label: Darla
description: Unlike most bands fitted with the "neo-shoegaze" tag, this eight-piece is never content to fall back on atmospherics alone.

title: The Sound of Girls Aloud / Overloaded
label: Polydor
description: The Sound of Girls Aloud / Overloaded

title: More Fish
label: Def Jam
description: Second record of the year from this Wu-Tang member isn't so much his sixth solo album as it is a glorified mixtape or the follow-up to 2004's Theodore Unit disc, 718.

title: Warp Works & Twentieth Century Masters
label: Warp
description: This 2xCD collection seeks to "explore the connection between electronic experimenters on the Warp label and their sonic grandfathers."

title: Do Easy
label: Fat Cat
description: Four years after releasing its debut LP Make It Pop, this indie rock band returns with a record that's just as bleak and ugly as its predecessor-- and yet is also more accessible.

title: No Heroes
label: Epitaph
description: Sixth full-length is packed with some of the most ferocious moments in the Boston quartet's 15-plus-year history.

title: Exodus Into Unheard Rhythms
label: Stones Throw
description: Stones Throw star and younger brother of Madlib samples exclusively from the catalogue of jazz/funk cult hero Galt MacDermot, but this buoyant and elegant record is no mere gimmick.

title: A Charlie Brown Christmas
label: Fantasy
description: Smart reissue of the enduring holiday classic includes alternate takes of several tracks and liner notes detailing the history of the project.

title: (A) Senile Animal
label: Ipecac
description: King Buzzo and Dale Crover team with the members of bass/drums duo Big Business and return to the Melvins' classic stoner metal sound.

title: Tierbeobachtungen
label: ~scape
description: Latest from the accomplished producer discards the sleek, gleaming microsound detail of Jelinek's earlier work for oddly cut loops of creaky old instruments like guitar and organ.

title: Springfield
label: Audika
description: Another collection of the late composer, singer, and disco producer's work, this one features a newly commissioned DFA remix.

title: The Blinding EP
label: Parlophone
description: Five-track EP from Pete Doherty and co. is the band's first offering since signing a major-label contract with Parlophone.

title: Silver / Secaucus
label: Grass
description: Silver / Secaucus

title: Anoint
label: I and Ear
description: This technically stunning record comes courtesy of diverse minimalist Mick Barr (Orthrelm).

title: Now Is the Time!
label: Tofu
description: Veteran Japanese band retains residual elements of its Brainiac-like spaz, but folds them into new wave pop.

title: The Tragic Treasury: Songs From a Series of Unfortunate Events
label: Nonesuch
description: On his fourth album of the year, Stephin Merritt compiles his contributions to the Unfortunate Events audiobooks: Fifteen songs of dejection, depression, and despair that add up to his most enjoyable record this century.

title: The Inspiration
label: Def Jam
description: On his second album, the Def Jam and mixtape star shows a muddled desire to transcend the clichés he helped create.

title: The Destroyed Room: B-Sides and Rarities
label: Geffen
description: This collection of non-album material features not only the expected instrumental sketches but also squiggly electronics, low-key folk, and rough blues.

title: Skoda Mluvit
label: City Slang
description: Dirk Dresselhaus continues to artfully mesh laptop processing, synth textures, and drums with his soulful, Sam Prekop-like voice.

title: Fast Food Nation OST
label: Park the Van
description: The soundtrack to Richard Linklater's fictional adaptation of Eric Schlosser's exposé of the fast food industry features Spoon, Friends of Dean Martinez, and Dr. Dog.

title: Skin and Bones
label: RCA
description: Alt-rock mainstays aim to uncover previously unheard nuances in their sound on this live acoustic record.

title: Sea Changes & Coelacanths: A Young Person’s Guide to John Fahey
label: Table of the Elements
description: The Table of the Elements label gathers two late-period albums along with the Hard Time Empty Bottle Blues EP to offer a rounded look at Fahey's restless final years, which veered from acoustic fingerpicking to solo electric guitar to experiments with Jim O'Rourke and Kevin Drumm.

title: En Nuestro Desafío
label: Better Looking
description: En Nuestro Desafío

title: Get Right With God
label: Brah
description: Scuzzy blooze rock with energy to spare treads the line between simple and stupid.

title: Dat Rosa Mel Apibus
label: Drag City
description: More freak than folk, this Drag City release is constructed mainly from simple, chunky piano patterns, dizzily swirling harmonies, droning strings, and Mira Billotte's booming lead vocals.

title: The Twilight Sad EP
label: Fat Cat
description: Epic rock from Glasgow that articulates youthful emotional grandeur through a radiant haze of overdriven guitar.

title: Legends of Country Music
artist: Bob Wills and His Texas Playboys
label: Columbia
description: The country music legend-- who was ahead of his time in almost every step of his four-decade career-- is honored with this 4xCD box set.

title: The Sweet Escape
label: Interscope
description: America's boldest pop star once again crafts a solo album that veers between the vanguard and the insipid.

title: Music For Plants
label: Kanine
description: On their third album the kaleidoscopic Brooklyn popsters continue the digitization process that began on last year's Contact Kid, integrating Atari bleeps into their sitar-tinged shuffle grooves.

title: Invasive Exotics
label: Monitor
description: Loose, Houston-based collective is focused around the trio of Tex Kerschen, Erika Thrasher, and Rodney Rodriguez and produces occasional moments of perfect, almost accidental symmetry.

title: Pleasure Ground
label: Load
description: With four hypnotically uncomplicated, 11-minute tracks, this is  Dominick Fernow at his simplest and most powerful.

title: Cake or Death
label: BPX1992
description: Lee Hazlewood faces his final curtain with some old friends, some laughs, and a few last words about the state of America.

title: Live at the Fillmore East
label: Reprise
description: Live at the Fillmore East

title: Sangue Puro
label: Tomlab
description: Inventive Montreal band moves from off-kilter dancepunk to something more claustrophobic and tribal on its new, Liars-like album.

title: Aerial Days
label: Fat Cat
description: Sheffield schoolteacher/artist Duncan Sumpner follows his long-simmering lo-fi debut with a record that's more sonically ambitious but still documents a deliberate sense of isolation.

title: Math and Physics Club
label: Matinee
description: Seattle-based indie pop quintet moves near the head of the tender-hearted, bookish class with its self-titled debut LP.

title: Music from The O.C. Mix 6: Covering Our Tracks
label: Warner Bros.
description: Latest mixtape from the teen soap opera-- on which B- and C-list indie bands cover mostly yupster contemporaries and indie rock standards-- has all the markings of a trend in its death throes.

title: Perception
label: Elektra
description: Rhino offers an extensive repackaging of this divisive and, in some circles, much-derided band's six albums, each complemented by a bonus disc of DVD footage and Surround Sound mixes.

title: Robot
label: Western Vinyl
description: To Rococo Rot producer focuses his creative energy on the robot on this entry into Western Vinyl's "Portrait Series".

title: Live at CBGB 1982
label: MVD Audio
description: Audio complement to the recently released DVD of the same name captures the legenday hardcore/reggae band at the peak of its power.

title: The Beatific Visions
label: Rough Trade
description: On their sophomore album, the UK indie rockers maintain their off-kilter aura while approximating the energy and style of the Ramones and Pixies.

title: The Knife / Deep Cuts
label: Mute
description: The Knife / Deep Cuts

title: LateNightTales
label: Unknown
description: LateNightTales

title: The Unsung Colony
label: Hush
description: Portland, Oregon-based indie-folk group crafts intimate scenes writ in miniature, small moments occasionally building up to big emotions or simply fading away.

title: Sunset at the End of the Industrial Age
label: Load
description: Brooklyn multi-instrumentalist duo daringly dance over the thin line between punks and hippies on this, their third Load LP.

title: Songs for the Gentle
label: Playhouse
description: Playhouse offers the debut album from these 12" single vets, and it's one of the best takes on post-minimalist, microsampled dance music of the year.

title: The Rakamonie EP
label: Konichiwa
description: With this five-track EP of mostly previously aired material, the chart pop star-turned-indie success aims to regain a commercial foothold outside of her native Sweden.

title: Stop the Clocks
label: Columbia
description: When compiling this contract-fulfilling 2xCD best-of, Noel Gallagher apparently realized what the rest of us have known for a decade: His band made all its best music in 1994-95.

title: Not Saying/Just Saying
label: Nrmls Wlcm Rcrds
description: Edmonton sextet is winning plaudits for its live show but having difficulty translating that energy onto its self-released debut.

title: Northern Stains
label: Important
description: These sonically busy artists-- one a Norwegian duo and the other a Brooklyn-based noise linchpin-- craft a smart synthesis of Giffoni's pointed, rapid-fire compositions and Fe-Mail's mix of sliced vocals, horns, and samples.

title: The Absent and the Distant
label: Caldo Verde
description: Singer-songwriter recruits members of 31Knots and Norfolk & Western to help her mold this intelligent and devastatingly downbeat "relationship" album, released on Mark Kozelek's label.

title: The Best of Vol. 1
label: Mute
description: This portable guide to the unlikely U.S. arena crossover band is proof that capitalism marches ever onward, and Generation X is still eager to seek comfort in misery-soaked nostalgia.

title: Love
label: Capitol
description: Love

title: Illuminated Manuscript
label: Polyvinyl
description: Touring drummer for Joan of Arc and full-time percussionist in Aloha is a one-man band crafting pieces that reference Neu! and Steve Reich.

title: Ensemble
label: Fat Cat
description: This creator of pristine electronic backdrops enlists Cat Power and Lou Barlow as vocalists on his Fat Cat debut.

title: Stowaway/Canonic: Scott Solter Plays Pattern Is Movement
label: NFI
description: Stowaway/Canonic: Scott Solter Plays Pattern Is Movement

title: In the Absence of Truth
label: Ipecac
description: The L.A.-based metal band builds on the template it solidified on the excellent Oceanic, creating a record that's more expansive and exploratory than anything the group has previously released.

title: 18 Singles
label: Island
description: Another career roundup from the flag-waving rock legends, this one focuses on the band's global singles and features two new songs, one of which is a collaboration with Green Day.

title: Précis
label: Kranky
description: Debut full-length from Michigan multi-instrumentalist is nostalgic, intimate, and sometimes maudlin, combining hazy lo-fi production with a whispered croon reminiscent of Elliott Smith.

title: Songs From Before
label: Fat Cat
description: The modern classical musician authors his most cohesive album to date, a record characterized by its brevity and near-pop dynamics.

title: Pac's Life
label: Interscope
description: The sixth posthumous 2Pac album-- not counting soundtracks, reissues, or greatest-hits sets-- is a Duets-like affair featuring contributions from T.I., Snoop Dogg, and Ludacris.

title: Orphans: Brawlers, Bawlers & Bastards
label: Anti-
description: This 3xCD box set is compartmentalized into style-segregated discs and features 30 new songs alongside a smattering of outtakes, soundtrack cuts, and other rarities.

title: Introducing...
label: Razzia
description: Introducing...

title: Backward Masks
label: Misra
description: The E6 vets' comeback record is a love it/hate it affair that rolls up the work of Danielson, Mercury Rev, and Flaming Lips into a ball of agreeable cuddle-rock.

title: School Was My Hustle
label: Rawkus
description: Chicago-born and Ivy League-credentialed MC Naledge teams with producer and Just Blaze pal Double-O in an attempt to resurrect the Rawkus imprint, but the result is more brains than heart.

title: Waiting for the Time to Be Right
label: Unknown
description: Drenched with reverb and framed in widescreen, the sophomore album from this Providence band blends hints of shoegaze with a power pop sensibility.

title: Everything Under the Sun
label: Interscope
description: From melodrama to MOR to a few stabs at metal machine music, this 5xCD box collects the entire recorded works of the Scott Walker-led group's anachronistic career.

title: Hell Hath No Fury
label: Jive
description: The long-suffering Pusha and Malice finally issue their troublesome sophomore album-- a record packed with a dozen unrelenting tales of desperation and distribution, glamour and gloating that features bleak, spare Neptunes beats. It was worth the wait.

title: Live a Little
label: Ashmont
