description: Joe Pernice enjoys a Scud Mountain Boys reunion of sorts, here teaming with original SMB producer Michael Deming and resurrecting a song he first recorded 13 years ago.

title: Mound Magnet
label: Thrill Jockey
description: With his Lithops project, Mouse on Mars' Jan St. Werner continues to explore the boundaries of what can be considered music.

title: Roots of Rumba Rock: Congo Classics 1953-1955
label: Crammed Discs
description: Crammed Discs comp documents the effects of Cuban son and bossa nova on the Belgian Congo.

label: Warner Bros.
description: Irish coffeehouse troubador and unlikely Shortlist Prize winner masters the art of the non-confession confession on his latest album.

title: Beast Moans
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Jagjaguwar presents the debut record from an indie supergroup consisting of Destroyer and New Pornographer Dan Bejar, Wolf Parade and Sunset Rubdown member Spencer Krug, and Frog Eyes' Carey Mercer.

title: Perfumed Lands
label: Melodic
description: Polished but unremarkable mope rockers from the Big Apple draw inspiration from Morrissey, Echo & the Bunnymen, and Interpol.

title: Variations for Piano and Tape
description: The latest in this muliptple-discipline artist's archival series is a  stark five-note piano theme, altered by glitches and dominated by melancholy.

title: Let's Build a Fire
label: Absolutely Kosher
description: Former Versus members' third album and first for Absolutely Kosher straddles the line between bedroom pop and more visceral full-band arrangements.

title: Tha Blue Carpet Treatment
label: Geffen
description: The West Coast vet-- still buoyant, lazy, mischievous, and sadly misogynistic-- unexpectedly crafts the best of this week's high-profile hip-hop releases.

title: Songs for Christmas
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: The indie singer-songwriter offers a holiday gift for his fans in the form of this elaborately packaged but very affordable 5xCD collection of straightforward Christmas-related songs.

title: 7 From the Village EP
label: Atlantic
description: Debut EP from this five-piece London outfit finds the group in a winsome, acoustic place, playing music supervisor-friendly indie pop.

title: Gala Mill
label: ATP
description: Improving on its strong second album, this Australian band makes an epic leap beyond garage rock, giving Gareth Liddiard space to spin his dark, literate, history-rich yarns.

title: Kingdom Come
label: Def Jam
description: The legendary rapper formally ends his retirement with a record that attempts to negotiate what the world's biggest and best hip-hop star is supposed to do on the mic as he approaches 40.

title: The Singles
label: Sony
description: New box set duplicates down to the smallest detail the singles the Clash released in the UK. It includes 19 CDs-- each packaged in its own sleeve, replicating the design of the original 7"-- all the attendant B-sides, 12" mixes, and promo-only cuts associated with each release.

title: Pyramids
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Pyramids

title: Danava
label: Kemado
description: Kemado band spices up the hipster metal landscape with its almost glam-rock, Hawkwind-like sound.

title: Samme Stof Som Stof
label: Paper Bag
description: This smart, elegant post-rock band is well loved in its native Denmark-- and in David Fricke's home.

title: Mudsuckers
label: Important
description: This drone supergroup features West Coast experimenters Robert Horton, Charalambides' Tom Carter, and Yellow Swans' Pete Swanson and Gabriel Mindel Saloman.

title: In My Own Time
label: Light in the Attic
description: Long lost folk legend who counts Devendra Banhart among her fans (yes, another one) has her sophomore album, originally released in 1971, reissued by Light in the Attic.

title: Zidane: A 21st Century Portrait OST
label: Wall of Sound
description: Scottish post-rockers provide the soundtrack for an experimental feature that follows Zinedine Zidane throughout the course of one full Real Madrid match.

title: Let's Build a Fire [Taiwan]
label: White Wabbit
description: This Taiwan-only version of the latest from the former Versus members was eventually rearranged, remixed, and re-mastered for its U.S. release.

title: Telescope Mind
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Despite some personnel shifts, this instrumental outfit-- two drummers, bass, electronics-- still sounds like a blend of Munich circa 1972 and the Dancetaria circa 1982.

title: Music for the Bluegrass States
label: Xeric
description: Improv guitarist weaves probing instrumentals that can be raw, dissonant, and rambling, but are never boring.

title: Are We Not Horses?
label: Rock Plaza Central
description: Toronto collective crafts a beguiling, often beautiful concept album that recalls the instrumentation of Neutral Milk Hotel and the metaphoric potential of Okkervil River.

title: Jarvis
label: Rough Trade
description: Five years after the demise of Pulp, Jarvis Cocker returns with a blunt, bleak peek at the decline of the West.

title: The Light at the End of the Tunnel is a Train
label: Dim Mak
description: Having already made a splash in the UK for their electro-rock fusion, the debut by London's Nathan J. Whitey and co. arrives stateside courtesy of the Dim Mak label.

title: Musik
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: The Detroit dream-pop band finally delivers a record that's more party than slumber.

title: Coal
label: Brassland
description: Berlin-based, Australian expats use slow-burning arrangements and goth-influenced rock of the Nick Cave/Black Heart Procession variety as the foundation for their melancholy sophomore album.

title: Hag: The Best of Merle Haggard
label: Capitol
description: The honky-tonk legend's career is celebrated with a 26-track album that covers 40 years of honest, American, working-man pride.

title: So Divided
artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
label: Interscope
description: The Austin band aims to rectify indie backlash and mainstream indifference with this elaborately orchestrated and structured new album.

title: ...Until the World Is Beautiful
label: Five 03
description: Portland, Oregon band's post-punk concoction-- drawing from the Cure, Joy Division, Comsat Angles, and others-- nails the sound but struggles with the songs.

title: Our Worn Shadow
label: Acuarela
description: One-man project from Bristol's Chris Cole-- whose worked with Crescent, Movietone, and Matt Elliott-- finds him using over a dozen instruments to conjure a dark, melodramatic mood.

title: Journey Into Paradise: The Larry Levan Story
label: Rhino
description: This 2xCD Rhino disc moves between documenting the legendary DJ's production nous and his good taste, intermingling tracks produced or remixed by Levan with tracks he simply liked to play.

title: The Peel Sessions: 1991-2004
label: Island
description: This choice selection of performances documents the powerhouse vocalist and legendary DJ's long-standing association, easy rapport, and friendship.

title: Doctor's Advocate
label: Geffen
description: After making a great album despite himself, the former Dr. Dre protégé has hardened his quirks into a likeably bizarre personal style and replicated the playfulness of his mixtapes on this, his sophomore LP.

title: Amid the Noise
label: Cantaloupe
description: This Brooklyn-based percussion ensemble follows its rigorous 2004 re-working of Steve Reich's minimalist landmark Drumming with a CD/DVD package much more rooted in the world of electronics.

title: Johnny and the Moon
label: Kill Devil Hills
description: Wolf Parade's Dante DeCaro attaches traditional folk topics and tones to contemporary rock idioms on his side band's debut LP.

title: Be He Me
label: Ace Fu
description: Ace Fu band behind the exquisite "Brother" offers an album of songs akin to the high-blood-sugar sounds of early Mercury Rev, but with classic-rock sheen, earthier lyrical concerns, and worldbeat dalliances.

title: At San Quentin [Legacy Edition]
label: Columbia Legacy
description: This 2xCD/DVD collection is the first release to the feature the Man in Black's complete legendary and controversial 1969 performance at California's oldest prison.

title: Ys
label: Drag City
description: Ys

title: Switzerland
label: Metropolis
description: Two albums on from their debut Fire, Dick Valentine and co. continue to work with arena-sized rock but have largely abandoned their visceral surf/punk/disco/metal sounds.

title: Threes
label: Hollywood
description: After losing bassist Paul Hinojos to Mars Volta, the other At the Drive-in spin-off regroups for another album of punk rock comfort food.

title: Songs for Creeps
label: High Plains Sigh
description: Following her covers album Fawns for Fangs, Amy Annelle's band returns with an album of haunted folk filled with strange gaps and distant radio transmissions.

title: Immer 2
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt's Michael Mayer follows 2002's Immer-- one of the best DJ mixes of the decade-- with a less-eclectic but still spacious and inviting sequel.

title: The Complete Motown Singles, Vol. 5: 1965
label: Hip-O Select
description: Hip-O-Select continues its crucial releasing of every Motown-related A- and B-side with six discs devoted to 1965, a year that included anthems from the Supremes, Marvin Gaye, the Temptations, the Miracles, Martha and the Vandellas, and the Four Tops.

title: Catapult Calypso
label: Sonic Unyon
description: Ambitious post-hardcore band doesn't always succeed with what it does, but it usually tends to sound interesting in the process.

title: The Truth Doesn't Matter
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Completed shortly before his death in March of this year, The Truth Doesn't Matter features some of the most personal and intimate songwriting of the former Swell Maps' frontman's long career.

title: IBM 1401 - A User's Manual
label: 4AD
description: On his first 4AD album, the Icelandic composer-- who has built a rewarding catalog based on ideas about technology and music-- takes the ache of nostalgia for obsolete technology and inflates the melodrama to airship proportions.

title: Milkwhite Sheets
label: V2
description: Following her surprising collaboration with Mark Lanegan, the former Belle & Sebastian cellist/chanteuse returns to her folksy roots on this collection of hushed, haunted songs.

title: Plague Songs
label: 4AD
description: This Artangel-curated project features tracks focusing on the plagues unleashed in the book of Exodus and includes contributions from Stephin Merritt, Scott Walker, Brian Eno & Robert Wyatt, Laurie Anderson, Rufus Wainwright, and others.

title: Mansions
label: Astralwerks
description: Through this singer-songwriter's six strings, the grace of Nick Drake brushes against the bustle of early Billy Bragg.

title: Micah P. Hinson and the Opera Circuit
label: Jade Tree
description: Texas songwriter's second full-length arrives with bolder and busier arrangements including horns, accordion, and fiddle, though his resonant voice remains the focus.

title: Disciples of California
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Comparatively tuneful wing of the Jewelled Antler Collective salute its home state, echoing Buffalo Springfield, Bay Area psychedelia, and Bakersfield country-rock.

title: Serious Times
label: XL
description: XL and former Fader editor Knox Robinson team to compile the best recent roots and lover's rock on this largely impressive 2xCD-- one mixed, one unmixed-- release.

title: We'll Build Them a Golden Bridge
label: Tinker
description: Scratch reissues Dan Bejar's lo-fi 1996 debut-- featuring a pair of songs that eventually resurfaced on New Pornographers records.

title: We Feel Safer at Night
label: self-released
description: Brooklyn indie rock band that once shared a member with Clap Your Hands Say Yeah also goes the self-released route.

title: I'm Thankful
artist: Spanky Wilson & the Quantic Soul Orchestra
label: Ubiquity
description: She's been recording since 1967, but this fine new record by Spanky Wilson fits nicely with the best of funk revivalists like Sharon Jones, Antibalas, and the Poets of Rhythm.

title: L'Enfant Assasin des Mouches
label: Suzelle
description: This French composer and producer-- best known for his lavish arrangements on Serge Gainsbourg's Histoire de Melody Nelson-- finally has his bizarre and astonishing 1972 solo debut issued on CD in the U.S.

title: Songbird
label: Lost Highway
description: The Red Headed Stranger teams with Ryan Adams (here handling production) and his backup band, the Cardinals, on another assortment of covers and new takes on his own songs.

title: Get Evens
label: Dischord
description: Fugazi frontman Ian MacKaye and ex-Warmers drummer Amy Farina follow their self-titled debut with a record that's as quiet and pretty as its predecessor, but also filled with anxiety.

title: Stories of Hope and Fear
label: Shout! Factory
description: Third collection of stories and monologues from the venerable Public Radio International program features contributions from host Ira Glass, David Sedaris, and John Hodgman.

title: Closet Freak: The Best of Cee-Lo Green the Soul Machine
label: Arista
description: Post-Gnarls Barkley comp thankfully shines a light on the talented, enigmatic artist's other work, but with only two solo LPs to his name-- and only two Goodie Mob songs included here-- this is a largely unnecessary collection.

title: Lightness
label: The Worker's Institute
description: Nomadic ex-Austinite Red Hunter peppers his sparse indie pop songs with sketches of women he's known, people he's never met, and a generous use of the egg shaker.

title: The Harry Smith Project
label: Shout! Factory
description: This 2xCD/DVD live package draws from a series of turn-of-the-millennium concerts celebrating the famed musicologist, and it features performances by Beck, Elvis Costello, Wilco, Steve Earle, Lou Reed, and Marianne Faithfull.

title: Wowee Zowee: Sordid Sentinels Edition
label: Matador
description: Matador and Pavement follow their 2xCD expanded reissues of Slanted and Enchanted and Crooked Rain, Crooked Rain with a deluxe Wowee Zowee package that includes B-sides rounding out the first disc, and a second CD of outtakes, radio shots, live songs, and compilation tracks.

title: Olesi: Fragments of an Earth
label: Stones Throw
description: On the prodigious r&b singer's Stones Throw-issued debut LP, hip-hop and free jazz co-mingle with tinges of electro, soul, and modern laptop mayhem.

title: Head Home
label: self-released
description: Walking the line between darkly evocative Americana and Southern Gothic cliché, New York band's commitment and cathartic energy eventually win out.

title: The Centre Will Hold
label: Holocene
description: Like Sleater-Kinney this Pac NW female-fronted punk band cops its name from a freeway exit and successfully infiltrates typically male-centric genres such as heavy metal and classic rock.

title: Go: The Very Best of Moby
label: V2
description: This best-of makes the polemical/practical decision to take Play as the dance producer's Year Zero, and therefore culls from his V2 albums-- adding a 2006 remix of "Go", a live version of "Feeling So Real", and a new single that features Debbie Harry.

title: Paper Tigers
label: Huume
description: On his third and most cohesive Luomo disc, Finnish producer Sasu Ripatti again works with multitracked and harmonized female vocals, and he seeks to infuse traditional verse/chorus structures with his characteristically horizontal sense of sprawl.

title: Lucky Boy
label: Ed Banger
description: Debut artist album from Ed Banger Records stabilizes a catalog built on shaky trends, and it provides the ideal get-up compliment to the rest of the label's all-out party artists.

title: Trees
label: self-released
description: Debut full-length from Christian Dautresme of HiM and the original rhythm section of Liars is propulsive, jagged, and unabashedly ugly.

title: And Now That I'm in Your Shadow
label: Secretly Canadian
description: The veteran singer-songwriter once again carries his accumulated fatigue and an aura of defeat on his latest collection of songs.

title: Shattered
label: Dirtnap
description: Just a few years after the tragic death of three of its members, this sorely missed band is eulogized with a collection of non-album material, including a handful of singles, unreleased tracks, and alternate mixes culled from the German vinyl release of their tremendous Guitar Romantic album.

title: Endless Wire
label: Interscope
description: Roughly 20 years past the release of a record called Who's Last-- and four years after the 2002 death of bassist John Entwistle-- Pete Townshend and Roger Daltrey return with an album that's split between sounding like a museum piece and sounding remarkably true to their younger selves.

title: Down Beside Your Beauty
label: Vice
description: Mannish bar rock in the vein of Afghan Whigs and the National from former Rollerskate Skinny vocalist Ken Griffin and former members of the Philly-based Aspera.

title: Surf Boundaries
label: Ghostly
description: Electronic minimalist embraces his pop streak, building on the promise of the Idol Tryouts Two comp track "Color Shifting".

title: Make History
label: Frenchkiss
description: Detroit post-punk band follows its 2005 sleeper album Justamoustache with its most disciplined, conventional rock record to date.

title: Hello Everything
label: Warp
description: Tom Jenkinson's latest Warp record is a sort of parallel universe Best of, featuring ideas that nearly all feel descended from previous Squarepusher albums.

title: Public Warning!
label: Def Jam
description: Roughly two-and-a-half-years after first making a big internet splash, the now Def Jam-signed, TRL-conquering Brit MC unleashes her debut album.

title: Nebulae
label: Melodic
description: As Outputmessage, Bernard Farley captures subtle gradations of mood within a narrow range, resulting in a record that sounds remote, dreamy, and chill.

title: We Are the Horrors EP
label: Stolen Transmission
description: This five-song EP comes courtesy of Ultragrrrl and the current NME cover stars, who are either studious garage-punk purists, Brit indie-tabloid fashionista fare, or a bit of both.

title: Rebels, Rogues & Sworn Brothers
label: Liberty and Lament
description: Fifth album from this Memphis band uses iconic rock'n'roll imagery and muscle-car riffs to chronicle a restless life full of drinking, bars, and girls.

title: Marie Antoinette OST
label: Verve Forecast
description: After using pop songs as active agents of characterization in both The Virgin Suicides and Lost in Translation, Sofia Coppola's film about the 18th century party-girl queen collects mostly postpunk and New Pop hits (from New Order, Gang of Four, Strokes, Adam & the Ants) on its first disc and borrowed instrumentals and low-key pop songs (from Aphex Twin, Squarepusher, and Air) on its second.

title: Altar
label: Southern Lord
description: Longtime Southern Lord labelmates, tourmates, and metal bands collaborate on this sometimes transfixing record.

title: Wandering Eyes
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Thrill Jockey-signed, Montreal-based singer-songwriter blends strains of folk, pop, and country into a naturalistic whole.

title: Who Needs Actions When You Got Words
description: British artist blends hip-hop, grime, and indie and comes across as a UK Sage Francis on his 679 debut.

title: Tribulation
label: Crucial Blast
description: The first Skullflower album to feature only Matthew Bower is also the densest and most extreme record released under the name, approaching the noisy abstraction of Merzbow and Metal Machine Music.

title: The Record Shop: 30 Years of Rough Trade Shops
label: V2
description: Rough Trade-- crucial to and sometimes even synonymous with UK independent music-- celebrates its 30-year anniversary with a compilation selected by musicians, critics, writers, and other luminaries.

title: Hollinndagain
label: St. Ives
description: This rare live album-- originally a vinyl-only issue limited to 300 copies-- captures the band in 2001, performing in the WFMU studios and while touring with Black Dice, and contains some of the strongest material from its noisy, neo-tribal days.

title: Ben Kweller
label: ATO
description: Wistful sighs garnished with homogeneous Ben Folds-style accompaniment.

title: White Hats
label: Tomlab
description: German singer Yvonne Cornelius plays with acoustic bossa nova-esque arrangements and darker electronic abstraction, but the hook is always her playfully arranged vocals.

title: Until Death Comes
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Swedish singer-songwriter's latest Secretly Canadian piano-driven record tackles growing up and toiling through excitement and ennui.

title: Body Riddle
label: Warp
description: Warp's Chris Clark infuses sonic streaks of contemporaries like Four Tet, Prefuse 73, and DJ Shadow into his repertoire, along with his usual Aphex and Boards of Canada tics, and in the process crafts his best album to date.

title: Pretty Little Head
label: Hungry Mouse
description: Treading more fluently in cabaret pop and frisky lounge swinging-- and dropping her raps-- the precocious singer-songwriter's second 2xCD album is self-released, self-produced, and an improvement on her debut.

title: Hi-Teknology 2: The Chip
label: Babygrande
description: Sophomore album from the architect of the Rawkus sound is a star-studded mix featuring guest verses from Nas, Talib Kweli, Jadakiss, and Ghostface Killah.

title: Rykestrasse 68
label: Propeller
description: Norwegian singer-songwriter follows her mosaic of intimate jazz and fractured pop miniatures with an album that's both grander and infused with more emotional turbulence.

title: Paper Television
label: K
description: Khaela Maricich, now joined by YACHT's Jona Bechtolt, crafts a wickedly generous and clever record of not-quite love songs and elaborately metaphored stabs at the rituals of simple human communication.

title: Joan of Arc
label: Table of the Elements
description: The drone and minimalim pioneer recorded this solo pump-organ improvisation-- created to accompany a Piero Heliczer film-- in 1968 at the home of John Vaccaro, director of New York's notorious Playhouse of the Ridiculous.

title: The World Is Gone
label: XL
description: The long-awaited debut from Various takes dubstep off of the dancefloor, and-- like Portishead's Dummy did a decade ago-- adds vocals and song structures to the defining sound of contemporary urban Britain.

title: Tomorrow's Eager Hands
label: Soft Abuse
description: This Vancouver-based band's organ-heavy collision of polish with zonk-out makes it come across as the New Zealand Pornographers.

title: A Raga For Peter Walker
label: Tompkins Square
description: Four new songs from the steel string guitar legend paired with previously unreleased contributions from others.

title: The Black Swan
label: Drag City
description: Influential British folk artist's Drag City debut is a terrific success, integrating his revered style with contributions from Beth Orton, Devendra Banhart, and Vetiver/Espers drummer Otto Hauser, among other guests.

title: American Hardcore: The History of American Punk Rock 1980-1986
label: Rhino
description: This soundtrack, culled from a documentary film of the same name, simultaneously traces the musical and geographical progression of the U.S.'s primary post-punk cultural movement.

title: It's a Feedelity Affair
label: Feedelity
description: This collection of the Norwegian producer's best-loved 12" tracks succinctly demonstrates why both he and his epic space-disco sound have been among the most ubiquitous forces in modern dance music.

title: Waters of Nazareth
label: Vice
description: French remixers score with a propulsive track that brings back the pitched-up hedonism of hardcore rave but have trouble keeping the momentum going.

title: The Longest Meow
label: Bloodshot
description: With help from members of My Morning Jacket, Trail of Dead, Lambchop, and Clem Snide, the Blooshot artist created this full length in only 11 hours, recording virtually all of it live.

title: Eccentric Soul: Mighty Mike Lenaburg
label: Numero Group
description: Numero Group once again strikes Eccentric Soul gold, this time by unearthing tracks written and recorded by Phoenix scenester and label owner Mike Lenaburg.

title: Working for a Nuclear Free City
artist: Working for a Nuclear Free City
label: Melodic
description: Like the Stone Roses or Screamadelica-era Primal Scream, these Mancunians purvey a druggy amalgam of rave, rock, and pop, generous with block-rockin' breakbeats, full-body bass grooves, and crystalline dream-pop comedowns.

title: Pussy Cats
label: Recordcollection
description: Hamilton Leithauser and co. faithfully cover the 1974 Harry Nilsson album recorded by his friend and drinking buddy John Lennon.

title: Calamity
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Former Deerhoof member Chris Cohen re-surfaces as the only permanent member of this Asthmatic Kitty-signed, stop-and-go pop group.

title: Voices of Animals and Men
label: Transgressive
description: The sometimes-compelling UK label Transgressive asks us to care about yet another post-punk revival band.

title: A Tom Moulton Mix
label: Soul Jazz
description: Soul Jazz honors this dance music pioneer and unofficial inventor of the disco 12" with a collection of some of the more than 4,000 extended mixes he crafted.

title: What It Is!
label: Rhino
description: Subtitled Funky Soul & Rare Grooves From the Vaults of Atlantic, Atco & Warner Brothers, 1967-1977, this 4xCD set is another outstanding soul/r&b collection from Rhino, and it features contributions from the Meters, Curtis Mayfield, Wilson Pickett, Allen Toussaint, and Sly Stone, among many others.

title: Noise Floor
label: Saddle Creek
description: Conor Oberst issues his second rarities collection, a set of B-sides, singles, compilation tracks, covers, and other rarities recorded between 1998 and 2005.

title: The Nice Boys
label: Birdman
description: New band fronted by guitarist Terry Six-- the only member of the Exploding Hearts to survive their tragic 2003 tour accident-- favors arena-ready power-pop with a glam-rock sheen.

title: The Lost Take
label: Anticon
description: Anticon's Martin Dosh gets help from Tapes 'n Tapes, Fog, and Andrew Bird on his latest album, which combines indie-style sincerity and intimacy with the propulsiveness of modern electronic music.

title: Flying Canyon
label: Soft Abuse
description: This debut album from Jewelled Antler mainstay Glenn Donaldson and others is full of memorable, refreshingly raga-free songs, a more intimate, traditional take on modern folk.

title: Be Still Please
label: Merge
description: On his latest release, Merge and Superchunk man Mac McCaughan returns to his indie rock roots and explores the orchestral and bossa nova sounds of his soundtrack and previous Portastatic work.

label: iTunes
description: Nike enlists James Murphy to craft an entry into its iTunes-only "Original Run" series, and the DFA leader turns out a 45-minute disco track.

title: Here
label: BBE
description: Debut solo album by Dutch producer known for his work with North Carolina's Justus League crew and with Phonte Coleman as Foreign Exchange.

title: Lovingkindness
label: Slow January
description: Three records in, this Portland band with an affinity for creative spelling is still settling on a style, as they bounce from sloppy twee to instrumental psychedelia to country-inflected balladry.

title: Global Clone
label: PACrec
description: This limited-edition collection of previously released cassette-only tracks finds the (D)YS working largely without rhythm, resulting in one of their most dreamy and gorgeous sets to date.

title: Robbers and Cowards
label: Downtown
description: Sound Team, Birdmonster, now these guys-- bloggers, raise your standards!

title: Visitations
label: Domino
description: UK art-rockers' fourth album finds them reinstating the lo-fi abrasion of their debut, marking a slight return to form.

title: Insomniac Doze
label: Temporary Residence
description: Japanese post-rock-cum-hardcore band leaves the thrash behind and wanders through a moody cinematic landscape reminiscent of Mogwai and Explosions in the Sky.

title: Nuclear Daydream
label: Lonely Astronaut
description: Singer-songwriter and recent New Orleans resident follows his 9/11 album with a post-Katrina set of songs.

title: Get Yr Blood Sucked Out
label: Barsuk
description: Husband/wife team Kevin and Anita Robinson has sharpened its sound on this, its fourth album, which boasts more spacious production, simpler arrangements, and more refined songcraft than previous efforts.

title: Born in the U.K.
label: Astralwerks
description: Damon Gough's fifth album in six years-- and first for EMI UK-- sports a rah-rah title, well-manicured production, and broad themes of love and loss.

title: Writer's Block
label: V2
description: Stockholm trio Peter Bjorn and John branch out on their latest LP, exploring everything from lo-fi 1980s electronics and shoegaze guitars to slacker beats and icy dreamscapes. The result is their most focused and fully realized album yet, and one of the better pop albums we've heard this year.

title: 10 Songs
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Bunky's Rafter Roberts unearths a collection of sprawling, multi-layered recordings he made at his San Diego studio in 1998 and 1999.

title: Born Ruffians
label: Warp
description: This promising debut EP comes courtesy of Warp's most traditonally indie rock-sounding band to date, a group with a lead singer as indebted to Isaac Brock as Brock once was to Black Francis.

title: Skeletal Remains
label: Savage Land
description: This posthumously released live set finds the mid-1990s Chicago No Wave revivalists-- which included members of U.S. Maple, the Flying Luttenbachers, and the Scissor Girls-- at the peak of their powers.

title: Trompe-L'oeil
label: Dare to Care
description: This French Canadian band creates a resolutely of-the-moment album that captures the ramshackle exuberance of CYHSY, the good humor of Broken Social Scene, and the screamy avant-pop of Wolf Parade.

title: We Are Glitter
label: Mute
description: This spacious, U.S.-only Supernature remix album features the work of Carl Craig, Alan Braxe & Fred Falke, DFA, the Flaming Lips, Múm, and Ewan Pearson.

title: Darkel
label: Astralwerks
description: The solo debut by Air's Jean-Benoît Dunckel, recorded while he was helming the recent Charlotte Gainsbourg album, evokes the woozy romance of his day job's slower tracks.

title: Lion Devours the Sun
label: Kranky
description: On his second album as Boduf Songs, Mat Sweet gives us another collection of intimate and in-your-face poetic ramblings that tend to circle back to death.

title: 120 Days
label: Vice
description: Vice-signed Norwegian dance-rock band builds songs full of grand gestures but doesn't neglect the details.

title: Xan Valleys EP
label: Modular
description: Ignore the technicolor togs and rave-rock revolution talk: This new UK band's debut EP features two froth-worthy singles, their B-sides, and a pair of remixes.

title: Harmony in Ultraviolet
label: Kranky
description: Latest from the electronic producer refines the sounds of his previous records, creating what is, paradoxically, Hecker's most dramatic and most oceanic album.

title: Be Where I Be
label: Flameshovel
description: Detroit quintet's second album is beautifully produced, brimming with intricate noises and carefully constructed loops, but frontman Daniel Johnson's songs are a harder sell.

title: The Maximum Black EP
label: self-released
description: Reissue of 1999 EP finds the band at their peak, looking to classic garage rock, proto-punk, and the lilting pop of the Byrds and Love as they run through eleven tunes (five previously unreleased) in 28 minutes.

title: Venus in Cancer
label: Blue Thumb
description: The reissue of this 1969 album affirms Basho's place alongside steel string guitar greats Fahey and Kottke, while his strange and otherworldly voice puts him in a class by himself.

title: Remember the Night Parties
label: Sub Pop
description: The Brooklyn-based band's third album of ambitious post-collegiate drinking songs-- its first on Sub Pop-- is cut from the boisterous jangle of 1980s U.S. indie.

title: Better Days Will Haunt You
label: Matador
description: This crucial set compiles the underrated indie rock band's entire recorded output on two remastered, chronologically arranged CDs, plus includes a DVD featuring a pair of videos and a European tour diary.

title: The Best of Tim Buckley
label: Rhino
description: This single-disc compilation of the singer's decade-long career, which was marked by critical praise but little commercial success, is marred by a choppy tracklist.

title: The Mylar Tantrum
label: Three Lobed
description: Latest from the collective is one uninterrupted performance that was created as an alternate soundtrack to Ira Cohen's legendary 1968 psychedelic film The Invasion of the Thunderbolt Pagoda.

title: The Orm
label: Iseler Communication
description: North Carolina duo debut with an album of abstract drone pieces incorporating guitar, found sound, and assorted electronics.

title: Normal Happiness
label: Merge
description: The prolific former Guided by Voices leader offers his fifth album...of 2006.

title: Yours to Keep
label: Rough Trade
description: Solo debut from the Strokes guitarist finds him trying his hand at a more cosmopolitan rock sound.

title: Radiodread
label: Easy Star
description: A sequel of sorts to Dub Side of the Moon, this set offers a reggae interpretation of OK Computer, complete with vocal contributions from Horace Andy and Toots Hibbert.

title: Fire on the Bright Sky
label: Warm
description: The former co-leader of Parker & Lily helms a new project that shrouds his songwriting and Morrissey-like tenor in back-alley country rather than his former group's twee electronics.

title: What Do I Wish for Now? (Singles & Extras 1994-2004)
label: LTM
description: Career-spanning singles and cast-offs collection from twee California-based miserablists who, despite their sunny desert origins, know from rainy days and Mondays.

title: The Last Resort
label: Poker Flat
description: Versatile Denmark native's debut LP is a home-listening record roughly divided between moody downtempo numbers and swirling, house-tempo cuts, and it thankfully includes a bonus disc of most of his previously released 12"s.

title: Beach House
label: Bella Union
description: In the tradition of Mazzy Star, Galaxie 500, Spiritualized, and Slowdive, this Carpark duo-- singer/organist Victoria Legrand and guitarist Alex Scally-- crafts lovesick, narcotized rock with lots of depth and sweep.

title: This Harness Can't Ride Anything
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Chicago indie rock band's second album finds the group blitzing through several different styles rather than settling on one approach.

title: Olé! Tarantula
label: Yep Roc
description: Working with Scott McCaughey, Peter Buck, and Bill Rieflin of the Minus 5, the former Soft Boys leader finds his flair for the surreal intact, but also tempers the weirdness with flashes of vulnerability.

title: Subliminal Genocide
label: Hydra Head
description: Malefic-- who made a memorable appearance on last year's Sunn 0))) LP Black One-- and his one-man USBM project makes its Hydra Head debut.

title: Young Machetes
label: V2
description: Rather than choosing between seducing or screaming at its audience, this V2 post-hardcore band aims to find a middle ground.

title: The DFA Remixes: Chapter Two
label: Astralwerks
description: Second collection of James Murphy and Tim Goldsworthy's remixes features reworkings of tracks by Goldfrapp, Hot Chip, Junior Senior, and Nine Inch Nails.

title: Trying to Never Catch Up
label: Barsuk
description: Scattershot Barsuk debut from this Austin, Texas band is a refangled version of its 2004 self-produced debut plus four tracks overseen by Spoon's Jim Eno.

title: Coney Island Baby
label: RCA
description: RCA reissues the enigmatic rocker's heartfelt follow-up to electronic-noise experiment Metal Machine Music, complete with remastering work and six extra tracks.

title: Chrome Children
label: Stones Throw
description: This 19-song mix CD/live DVD, released in association with Cartoon Network's Adult Swim, celebrates the vitality of Peanut Butter Wolf's Stones Throw imprint and features previously unheard contributions from Madlib, J Dilla, and Oh No.

title: Roots and Crowns
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Tim Rutili's Chicago collective outdoes itself on this record, which sounds like ancient mountain and Delta traditions synthesized-- scratched up, muddied, and re-imagined for an America more reliant on machines than the grace of God.

title: Trying to Never Catch Up
label: Barsuk
description: Scattershot Barsuk debut from this Austin, Texas band is a refangled version of its 2004 self-produced debut plus four tracks overseen by Spoon's Jim Eno.

title: Coney Island Baby
label: RCA
description: RCA reissues the enigmatic rocker's heartfelt follow-up to electronic-noise experiment Metal Machine Music, complete with remastering work and six extra tracks.

title: Chrome Children
label: Stones Throw
description: This 19-song mix CD/live DVD, released in association with Cartoon Network's Adult Swim, celebrates the vitality of Peanut Butter Wolf's Stones Throw imprint and features previously unheard contributions from Madlib, J Dilla, and Oh No.

title: Roots and Crowns
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Tim Rutili's Chicago collective outdoes itself on this record, which sounds like ancient mountain and Delta traditions synthesized-- scratched up, muddied, and re-imagined for an America more reliant on machines than the grace of God.

title: Mosaic
label: Sounds Familyre
description: Mosaic

title: Awesome Color
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Ecstatic Peace band's melodic fuzz and throaty howls ape the Stooges and other 1970s hard rock greats.

title: Melody Mountain
label: Rune Grammofon
description: Building on the unusual interpretations it performs live, the Norwegian duo recorded an entire album of covers; unlikely choices including AC/DC's "It's a Long Way to the Top" and Kiss' "Crazy, Crazy Nights" are slowed to a crawl and injected with a sense of bleak foreboding.

title: The Word From Pluto
label: Hello Sir
description: With influences ranging from Les Savy Fav to Devo, this indie rock band makes dance-punk, spazz-rock, rawk-revival, and post-hardcore-- all for at least a minute at a time.

title: PopArt: The Hits
label: Capitol
description: Released three years ago in the UK, this 2xCD best-of-- splitting the synth-pop group's impulses into "Pop" (disco) and "Art" (ballads)-- is finally issued in the U.S.

title: Overboard & Down EP
label: Low Transit Industries
description: Will Sheff's brainy indie band again speaks fluently through misery-heavy characters on this Australian tour EP.

title: Soft Machine
label: Atlantic
description: Swedish grindcore-cum-stereo selector trio make its North American debut with an eclectic album featuring contributions from Annie, Elephant Man, and Neneh Cherry, among others.

title: In the Maybe World
label: Young God
description: Veteran singer/songwriter continues her push-pull between pretty and unsettling on this, her seventh album.

title: See Mi Yah Remixes
label: Burial
description: Rhythm & Sound makes a welcome return to the dancefloor on a remix album that's both an homage to Basic Channel's dubwise legacy and a repudiation of reflexive brow-furrowing.

title: for hero: for fool
label: Astralwerks
description: Marking both its major-label debut and first album since a van accident that left keyboardist Dax Pierson paralyzed, the idiosyncratic hip-hop collective creates a set that's harder, angrier, and, yes, better than anything it has previously done.

title: Sam's Town
label: Island
description: Much-maligned band follows the crossover hit Hot Fuss by switching its influences from the Cure and 1980s UK new wave to Bruce Springsteen and 1970s earnest U.S. classic rock.

title: ...Until We Felt Red
label: Velour
description: After two albums of ornate fingerpicking and sedate slides, this guitarist and 90s Chicago post-rock aficianado adds breathy vocals to her arsenal.

title: As Tall as Lions
label: EastWest
description: Sophomore release from Long Island rockers is schmaltzy alterna-rock that splits the difference between Jeff Buckley and Coldplay.

title: Noxagt
label: Load
description: Norwegian math-metal outfit replaces Nils Erga's viola with guitar from Anders Hana of Ultralyd, but Noxagt's dark, punishing vision remains intact.

title: Yeti #4
label: Yeti
description: The latest edition of Mike McGonigal's arts and music journal includes a 28-track CD featuring rare or previously unreleased recordings from Destroyer, Okkervil River, and Page France.

title: The Information
label: Interscope
description: The Information

title: This Cursed House
label: Quite Scientific
description: Based not in the Great White North but Ann Arbor, Mich., this upstart septet proves it has a handle on recent indietastic touchstones Sufjan Stevens and the Arcade Fire.

title: City & Eastern Songs
label: Rough Trade
description: Rough Trade antifolk singer-songwriter and comic book artist teams with his bass-playing brother on his first foray into more studio-shiny territory.

title: On Leaving
label: Fat Cat
description: Despite moving from Touch and Go to Fat Cat, the underrated songstress again worked with Steve Albini on the creation of her latest album, a sparse record that eschews the eclecticism of 2003's Run to Ruin and pulls back on experimentation.

title: Friendly Fire
label: Capitol
description: John and Yoko's son returns with his first album in eight years, a record steeped in baroque piano-bar melodies, foreboding Jon Brion string arrangements, and a palpable sense of empty-bed despair.

title: The Crane Wife
label: Capitol
description: Colin Meloy's theatrical and hyperliterate band makes an unexpected move to Capitol Records, and delivers a record that matches the ambition of its new imprint.

title: Shine On
label: Elektra
description: NSFW

title: Carnavas
label: Dangerbird
description: Smashing Pumpkins soundalikes from L.A. spin spiderweb-rock and scream a lot.

title: Legacy: The Best of Mansun
label: Parlophone
description: Career summary of versatile, 1990s British pop band includes some surprisingly durable highlights, but suffers from dodgy sequencing.

title: Release Therapy
label: Def Jam
description: Up till now, Ludacris has never truly lived up to his name.  It's finally going "serious" that crossed the line.

title: Boys and Girls in America
label: Vagrant
description: Like an American Jarvis Cocker, Craig Finn narrates tales of kids who dance and drink and screw cuz they've got nothing else to do-- and he does it all with a depth and scope rarely seen in contemporary rock.

title: Heat Chief
label: HOSS
description: Baltimore quartet-- pronounced "Wet Hearts"-- aim for a Boredoms-like transcendence through repetition and incremental adjustments.

title: Today Is Tonight
label: Drama Club
description: Promising Chicago indie band follows its EP with a record that boils down its well-worn influences to a distinctive sound.

title: The Odd Church
label: Hybris
description: Swedish band's third record is frontloaded with hooky songs reminiscent of loudly melodic artists like Pixies and the Ramones.

title: Gang of Losers
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Montreal post-Britpop band follows its well-publicized 2003 album No Cities Left with a record that mixes jangly pop with darker material.

title: There Is a Season
label: Columbia
description: This 4xCD box splits its four discs evenly between the two distinct phases of the band-- the proto-jangle, folk-pop group and the country-rock pioneers-- and includes a bonus DVD of 1960s TV appearances.

title: Wild Yams
label: Indikator
description: Fronted by Pavement's former drummer, Steve West, Marble Valley's third album is full of reliable indie rock-- plus, it's funny.

title: 1980-82 Collected
label: Acute
description: Black Dice/Liars-like No Wave band has its output collected, including a self-titled LP, the Night After Night EP, and a generous assortment of previously unreleased live and studio rarities.

title: At the Speed of Twisted Thought
label: Touch and Go
description: Summation of the seminal hardcore band's brief career includes early singles, demos, and live tracks from its 1981 tour.

title: The Lemonheads
label: Vagrant
description: After years as a sort of high-profile busker, Evan Dando recruits a couple of former Descendents and reimagines the Lemonheads, leaning more toward the group's punk-tinged beginnings than its sunny, major-label pop.

title: The Essential Mercury Rev: Stillness Breathes 1991-2006
label: V2
description: This 2xCD collection features one disc of the best of Jonathan Donahue's innovative modern psychedelia band and another of outtakes, B-sides, and covers.

title: If Thine Enemy Hunger
label: Relapse
description: Fuzz-rock group brings 1990s alterna-metal into the 21st century, just like they've been doing for a decade.

title: The Kids at the Club
label: How Does It Feel to Be Loved?
description: Compilation from a label affiliated with London club night How Does It Feel to Be Loved? surveys the current indie pop landscape, including tracks from Voxtrot, I'm From Barcelona, and Amelia Fletcher.

title: Berlin Serengeti
label: Ubiquity
description: Genre-crazed project helmed by Berlin's Niko Schabel is a cinematic tour through rock, soul, bossa nova, dub, trip-hop, Middle Eastern modes, and much more.

title: Dreamt for Light Years in the Belly of a Mountain
label: Astralwerks
description: Five years in the making, Mark Linkous' latest was recorded piecemeal and features contributions from Tom Waits, Danger Mouse, and the Flaming Lips' Steve Drozd.

title: Remixes
label: Domino
description: Remixes

title: El Gran Baile
label: Emperor Norton
description: Uwe Schmidt, also known as Atom Heart, Se\xF1or Coconut, and several dozen other\n\ aliases (he's released more ...

title: Forever Debts
label: Semaphore
description: Second album from the power-pop artist is a shade darker than its predecessor, but with sharply observed lyrics that don't so much tell stories as dig around in the feelings that well up during a story's climax.

title: Slappers
label: !K7
description: Second solo album from Matthew Herbert's frequent chantuese features less of his productions and more song-based structures.

title: The Rough Guide to Planet Rock/The Rough Guide to West African Gold
label: World Music Network
description: The Rough Guide to Planet Rock/The Rough Guide to West African Gold

title: Wait EP
label: Good
description: With the release of its third album delayed until 2007, the oversized Texas band offer this iTunes EP, featuring two new songs and covers of Nirvana, the Psychedelic Furs (both produced by Jon Brion), and Spree frontman Tim DeLaughter's former band, Tripping Daisy.

title: Okonokos
label: ATO
description: Recorded at San Francisco's famed Fillmore West, this 2xCD, 21-track live album finds the Kentucky band shedding its regional associations and signature reverb but still reinventing classic rock.

title: Time Without Consequence
label: Zero Summer
description: The Scottish-born, London-raised, and Los Angeles-living Nick Drake soundalike finally issues his long-awaited debut album.

title: Arts & Crafts
label: Memphis Industries
description: Steve Webster moves between the monsters of art school post-punk, kraut rock, and late-1990s slacker electronica on his debut Memphis Industries LP.

title: Dark Light Daybreak
label: Saddle Creek
description: Saddle Creek dream-pop band apes the song construction and messianic guitar rock of U2.

title: Meek Warrior
label: Young God
description: After this year's spectacular split-release with Angels of Light, these Young God artists take a more elemental, toned-down approach. Jazz drummer Hamid Drake guests.

title: Ta-Dah!
label: Polydor
description: The second album from the disco-tinged group is even more streamlined, pop-minded, and high-spirited than its 2004 self-titled debut.

title: Into the Blue Again
label: Sub Pop
description: Composer/multi-instrumentalist James LaValle takes his post-rock band on a tour of the genre's familiar haunts.

title: The Bells of 1 2
label: Grönland
description: The debut album from this classically trained pianist and cellist and Sparklehorse compatriot is intended to be an enormous statement about the nature of humanity and the metaphysics of love.

title: Personality: One Was a Spider, One Was a Bird
label: Astralwerks
description: Eccentric Australian songwriter Luke Steele returns with a record that's essentially 13 remixes of John Lennon's 1974 spaced-odyssey "#9 Dream".

title: And What Have You Done With My Body God?
label: ZTT
description: This 4xCD set celebrates the work of Trevor Horn and Paul Morley's early 1980s collective-- a highly conceptual group that used primitive sampling technology to become pioneers of electro, hip-hop, and Latin freestyle and house.

title: Up from the Catacombs: The Best of Jane's Addiction
label: Rhino
description: Rhino gathers the best from Perry Farrell's trailblazing band-- a group that somehow managed to capture the sum total of 1980s underground music culture and lay the sonic groundwork for the decade that followed.

title: The Man Who Lives for Love
label: Yep Roc
description: Originally issued in Japan in 2001, this collaboration between Jon Spencer and brothers Luther and Cody Dickinson (the North Mississippi All-Stars) is finally released in the U.S., aided by the addition of six bonus tracks.

title: Have You Seen the Other Side of the Sky?
label: Ace Fu
description: Makoto Kawabata and his psych-rock juggernaut reunite with the Melting Paraiso U.F.O. ensemble after a yearlong hiatus.

title: On Cutting Ti-Gers in Half and Understanding Narravation
label: New Granada
description: Idiosyncratic chamber-pop group offers a debut record full of emotionally fraught compositions.

title: Human Animal
label: Sub Pop
description: The Sub Pop noise group returns with another collection of tracks exploring the cycle of tension and release.

title: Food & Liquor
label: Atlantic
description: Debut album from the Chicago MC and Kanye West protégé is proudly out of step with contemporary hip-hop-- despite contributions from his mentor, Jay-Z, and the Neptunes.

title: Here Is...
label: V2
description: Former alterna-metal band Loudermilk recasts itself as hooky alt-rock throwbacks.

title: Takers and Leavers EP
label: Park the Van
description: Philadelphia trad-rock band teases two tracks from its forthcoming LP on yet another gutless paean to classic pop.

title: Appreciation Night
label: Flameshovel
description: Chicago indie rock band builds on the promise of its debut EP with an album full of fuzzy guitars and turn-on-a-dime shifts in rhythm and tone.

title: Respect M.E.
label: Atlantic
description: The hip-hop superstar finally has her inventive, brilliant singles compiled onto one disc. The rub: It's only out in the UK.

title: Blood Mountain
label: Reprise
description: Prog-metal's best band returns with a record that may be even better than its monumental Leviathan LP. Please welcome the new monsters of rock.

title: Son of the Tiger
label: Frenchkiss
description: Brooklyn trio plays noisy, mostly instrumental post-rock that ranges from dark and gloomy to raucous and explosive.

title: Waiting for the Next End of the World
label: Dischord
description: Former Jawbox and Burning Airlines leader J. Robbins returns with his first full-length in five years, this follow-up to his new trio's 2004 EP Waiting for the Next End of the World.

title: Talk to la Bomb
label: Verve Forecast
description: Second album from versatile New York contingent improves on its debut, playing down the call-and-response jams while making more imaginative use of electronics.

title: Knives Don't Have Your Back
label: Last Gang
description: Metric leader and Broken Social Scene member offers frank takes on misery, simple piano figures, and subtle adornments on her first proper solo release.

title: The Outsider
label: Interscope
description: Josh Davis' third album is an odd mélange of exotica, hyphy, and alt-rock, featuring guest spots by both David Banner and Christina Carter. No, really.

title: Violence Is Golden
label: Dim Mak
description: Dim Mak band's debut is in places reminiscent of a mid-1990s synth-grunge crossover, PJ Harvey-like goth-pop, or nu-blues rock such as the Kills.

title: Foundation Sounds
label: Empyrean
description: The album-length return of orchestral pop figure Eric Matthews, which in a limited edition also includes a five-song EP, finds him back in a lushly arranged world of meticulous songcraft.

title: Electrice
label: Kranky
description: Recorded and mixed by the Charalambides member herself, this album's four extended drones each share a profound sense of dislocation and existential yearning.

title: AWOO
label: Rough Trade
description: The Canadian indie pop collective's latest album drops much of the potty-minded content and harps'n'horns extravagance of its predecessors.

title: The Letting Go
label: Palace
description: On his latest record, Will Oldham enlists the help of Faun Fables vocalist Dawn McCarthy to create a record that presents the humor, dread, and resignation that inform his best music in blissfully unfiltered form.

label: Atlantic
description: Film actress and daughter of Serge Gainsbourg and Jane Birkin gets help from Jarvis Cocker, Air, Neil Hannon, and Nigel Godrich on her second album.

title: Tell Me
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Full-length debut by Chicago roots-rockers veers from swampy gospel to taut funk, adding instrumentation to flesh out the sound of their EP Please Come Back.

title: Dreams
label: Bubbles
description: Kings of Convenience leader and self-proclaimed "singing DJ" Erlend Øye returns with his most "rock" effort to date.

title: Total 7
label: Kompakt
description: The latest compilation from Komapkt's venerable Total series collects vinyl releases and exclusive tracks and finds the label again entrenched at the center of frantic back-and-forth movements within German dance music circles.

title: And I Feel Fine
label: Capitol
description: Subtitled The Best of the I.R.S. Years 1982-1987, this 2xCD set collects the best of the landmark band's pre-major label output, reminding us that a lifetime ago the group enjoyed a period of sustained and boundless creativity and helped to define and codify indie rock.

title: Hell Songs
label: Hydra Head
description: Providence's resident shock artists return with more techy grindcore, now mixed with elements of Nation of Ulysses and the Make Up.

title: Stella
label: Touch and Go
description: Dovetailing nicely with the recent Touch & Go anniversary shows, this Sicilian band makes a welcome comeback, offering its first new album in eight years.

title: Meadow
label: Merge
description: Former folkie picks up where his 2004 Merge bow Dents and Shells left off-- creating melodically portentous tracks topped with his gruff yet honeyed voice.

title: The Air Force
label: 5RC
description: Jamie Stewart's engaging, unflinching band unleashes its most understated and relatively sweetest album to date.

title: Transparent Things
label: Tirk
description: Fujiya & Miyagi aren't Japanese; they just want to be. But while Nippon culture may be this Brighton, England trio's first love, musically they're doing for 70s krautrock and motorik what the DFA did for early 80s electro.

title: Peeping Tom
label: Ipecac
description: Six years in the making, this Mike Patton-led project features contributions from Massive Attack, Norah Jones, Kool Keith, Bebel Gilberto, and members of the Ninja Tune and Anticon rosters.

title: Acoustics
label: 5RC
description: Zach Hill and Spencer Seim offer precise acoustic versions of tracks from their recent albums Hold Your Horse Is and The Devil Isn't Red.

title: Dance Away the Terror
label: Park the Van
description: Third album by Capitol Years mixes the rock of Let Them Drink and the Jewelry Store EP with three-part harmony power pop.

title: Fading Trails
label: Secretly Canadian
description: The prolific Jason Molina returns with an album that synthesizes his old, solo Songs:Ohia work with the full-band, blues-influenced rock he's been crafting for the past few years.

title: FutureSex / LoveSounds
label: Jive
description: The pop star offers his ambitious, grandiose sophomore album: Almost entirely produced by Timbaland-- and with a more pronounced hip-hop edge than its predecessor-- the album abandons the feelgood sheen which the Neptunes peddled so adroitly on his debut, Justified, but makes up for it with the largesse of its sonic embrace.

title: Love & Other Planets
label: Domino
description: Fridge bassist's second solo album of soft folk-pop is a gentler affair than its predecessor.

title: Make Love to the Judges With Your Eyes
label: Dim Mak
description: Dim Mak debut LP finds the quartet's darling ramshackle insouciance sharing time with a ramshackle sincerity.

title: Lanzafame
label: Catbird
description: Released by a blogger's label, this debut perhaps unsurprisingly sounds a lot like the Arcade Fire and other contemporary indie bands; that's not necessarily a bad thing.

title: Amputechture
label: Interscope
description: The Mars Volta's new album is partially a Lynchian pro-immigration statement that, we assume, will thrill lovers of musical onanism.

title: Pieces of the People We Love
label: Interscope
description: Three years after the still-wonderful Echoes, the former DFA band team with Paul Epworth, Ewan Pearson, and Danger Mouse to helm a more meticulous, cleaner version of their once-gritty indie-dance sound.

title: Ethnic Minority Music of Northeast Cambodia
label: Sublime Frequencies
description: Sublime Frequencies gathers three years' worth of field recordings from Cambodia's mountainous northeastern Ratanakiri province.

title: Another Thought
label: Point
description: Originally released in 1994-- two years after the enigmatic downtown NYC cellist/composer died of AIDS-- Orange Mountain reissues this oft-forgotten piece of Russell's musical legacy.

title: The Wee Hours Revue
label: V2
description: One of the great unsubstantiated rumors of modern pop-rock, this Chapel Hill-based pop/soul/country act gets ready for its closeup with help from producer Chris Stamey.

title: Magic Potion
label: Nonesuch
description: Classic rock-loving blues-rock duo follow the warm Rubber Factory-- and make its Nonesuch bow-- with this more austere collection.

title: I Am Not Afraid of You and I Will Beat Your Ass
label: Matador
description: Indie rock vets follow the disappointing Summer Sun with an expansive, ambitious record exploring every style in their repertoire, and a few new ones, too.

title: Three's Co.
label: Rough Trade
description: Echo Park retro-rock band once again mixes the sun-soaked power pop proclivities of Teenage Fanclub with the sylvan jangle of Felt.

title: Sing Song EP
label: Astralwerks
description: Joyful indie pop makers from Los Angeles push the limits of cheery, and sort of succeed.

title: Post Cro-Magnon Drift
label: Yellow Ball
description: Mark Lesseraux's free-associative lyrics and powerful delivery head an indie band now exerting more control over its sound, locating a balance between grit and sophistication.

title: Nautical Antiques
label: Ace Fu
description: Subtitled A Selection of Rarities From 1998-2001, this collection of leftovers is characterized by the band's anemic grooves and clockwork beauty.

title: Pet Sounds: 40th Anniversary
label: Capitol
description: Pet Sounds: 40th Anniversary

title: Reaper of Souls
label: Abacus
description: Norwegian metal band blends death metal, thrash, and hardcore, but ultimately ends up sounding just like everyone else.

title: K1
label: Arena Rock
description: Debut album from this Oregon band is catchy, but conceptually clunky.

title: Living Room
label: Plug Research
description: Latest project from Ammoncontact's Carlos Niño mixes *TNT­-*style post-rock, neo-shoegaze indie pop, and lyrical after-the-rain jazz fusion.

title: Varcharz
label: Ipecac
description: Appropriately, the German electronic group's first album on Mike Patton's Ipecac label is its heaviest to date, running bouncy instrumentals through a filter that renders the music colder, blockier, louder, and flatter.

title: B'Day
label: Sony
description: On her second solo album, the former Destiny's Child singer mostly eschews balladry, melisma, and clean pop, instead delivering a tight, energetic set heavy on upbeat numbers and funk affectations.

title: Gravity Won't Get You High
label: Interscope
description: Brisbane band tries to capture its manic live energy on record, with help from famed producer Brian Deck.

title: Live in: Nerd Rage!
label: Relapse
description: "Mr. Show" vet covers everything from porn to Star Wars to post-war Iraq on this Relapse-released comedy album.

title: Zeno Beach
label: Yep Roc
description: Australian proto-punks break a quarter-century of silence on record with forceful new material that matches and even surpasses the work that made them legends.

title: Serene Velocity: A Stereolab Anthology
label: Rhino
description: Yes, another Stereolab compilation; this one focuses on the band's 11 years on Elektra Records.

title: Yellow House
label: Warp
description: Edward Droste follows his group's lo-fi debut Horn of Plenty by employing a fulltime band, moving to Warp, and expanding his ambition and sound. The result is a major step forward for the group, as well as one of the year's best records.

title: Feeling the Fall
label: spinART
description: With a name cribbed from a Kinks album, Portland, Oregon's Village Green predictibly offer a mish-mash of classic rock influences on its debut.

title: Rogue's Gallery
label: Anti-
description: This 2xCD collection, subtitled Pirate Ballads, Sea Songs, and Chanteys, features contributions from an oddball cast that includes Bono, Nick Cave, Sting, and John C. Reilly.

title: To the Races
label: Saddle Creek
description: First proper solo release from Crooked Fingers mastermind is full of spare and intimate folk songs.

title: Ultimate Prince
label: Rhino
description: This Prince best of covers the Warner Brothers years-- 1979-92-- and features one disc of album versions and one of 12" mixes.

title: Crazy Itch Radio
label: XL
description: After three records of musical maximalism, Simon Radcliffe and Felix Buxton unveil a new kind of Basement Jaxx album: A grower, one that doesn't exhaust you the first time around the track but one that accrues meaning and gets more enjoyable with each new spin.

title: A Little Place in the Wilderness
label: Good Fences
description: Second album from this side project led by Stars' Torquil Campbell finds him creating understated, bookish chamber pop.

title: Complete Studio Recordings 1982-1984
label: Subterranean
description: Political San Fran hardcore band-- that played with Minutemen funk and flirted with the melodic sound that Dag Nasty and others would later perfect-- has its studio output issued on CD.

title: Good God! A Gospel Funk Hymnal
label: Numero Group
description: Numero Group examines the intersect between gospel and funk on the label's latest well-crafted compilation.

label: Drag City
description: Latest record from the former Slint and Tortoise player finds him emphasizing traditional craft and instrumentation instead of brooding experimentation.

title: Paris 1919
label: Reprise
description: Rhino reissues this stately, haunting masterpiece, adding 11 previously unreleased tracks-- nearly tripling the running length of the original album.

title: One Day It Will Please Us to Remember Even This
label: Roadrunner
description: Glam-punk pioneers stage an unlikely and possibly unwelcome comeback.

title: All This Time
label: Fat Possum
description: Unpretentious Midwestern blues-rock duo delivers its sophomore Fat Possum release.

title: Oxytocin
label: Makeshift Music
description: The band's third album finds them thinking big, as they pile on instruments and layer harmonies into massive choirs.

title: Live at KEXP Volume 2
label: KEXP
description: The famed Seattle radio station's second sessions compilation  covers indie rap, indie rock, indie pop, indie folk, and indie revival-- and features contributions from Sleater-Kinney, M.I.A., Band of Horses, and Tapes 'n Tapes.

title: Game Theory
label: Def Jam
description: On its Def Jam debut, the veteran hip-hop band avoids wilds tangents and trims some of its freewheeling ways; the resulting record is svelte, smart, lively, and one of the year's most pleasant surprises.

title: A Million Microphones
label: Touch and Go
description: This Washington D.C. dance-punk band, made of former members of El Guapo, show promise on its second Touch & Go release.

title: The Sad Part
label: Black Freighter
description: Led by Pitchfork contributor Michael Idov, this band's wit, tact, and striking language serves specificity and beauty, not Decemberists-style ostentation.

title: Ashes Against the Grain
label: The End
description: Oregon metal band's latest record is their hugest, most artful collection to date.

title: Kelis Was Here
label: Jive
description: The r&b singer returns with her fourth album and first without regular collaborators the Neptunes, teaming instead with a revolving cast that includes Scott Storch, Will.I.Am, Shondrae, and Raphael Saadiq.

title: Post-War
label: Merge
description: Consistently rewarding Merge singer-songwriter gets help from Neko Case and My Morning Jacket's Jim James on his latest album.

title: Sorry About the Flowers
label: One Percent Press
description: Athens band's debut is full of doleful, nostalgic pop, with strings, keys, and bells augmenting the traditional guitar-led lineup.

title: Garden Cities of To-morrow
label: Boompa
description: Sophomore record by Canadian chanteuse finds her working with production team Hercules, who back her whimsical songs with lavish arrangements.

title: Digital Disco 3
label: Force Tracks
description: Third volume of the recently re-opened ForceTracks label Digital Disco is helmed by the minimal house imprint's new rising star.

title: Thunder Down Under
label: Swami
description: Culled from in-studio performances recorded in an Australia radio station, this posthumous live album fails to capture the group's in-person prowess.

title: Modern Times
label: Columbia
description: The music legend returns with a companion piece to 2001's Love and Theft, offering new tracks of jazz-inspired, rockabilly-scamming, ragtime-aping rock'n'roll, more heavily indebted to blues and honky-tonk than Woody Guthrie and Folkways.

title: New Attitude EP
label: Marriage
description: An EP formerly available only at shows sees a proper release.

title: Folk Off!
label: Sunday Best
description: This 2xCD comp is split between artists based in North America and the British Isles and features contributions from Sufjan Stevens, Animal Collective, Vashti Bunyan, and Espers, among others.

title: Over the Mountain, Across the Valley, and Back to the Stars
label: Matador
description: Indie folk singer's third album-- and first for Matador-- includes forthright lyrics and vocal performances and songs inspired by the deaths of her two sisters.

title: Damaged
label: Merge
description: Kurt Wagner's shapeshifting group offers its 10th album, this one featuring the contributions and influence of Nashville-based laptop group Hands Off Cuba.

title: The Future Crayon
label: Unknown
description: Endlessly rewarding English avant-pop band gathers its post-Work and Non-Work B-sides, EP tracks, and compilation rarities.

title: Bring That Beat Back
label: Koch
description: The once-visionary hip-hop outfit offers up its later work, along with first single "Public Enemy No. 1", to remixers like Rae & Christian and Johnny Juice.

title: No Midnight
label: spinART
description: Indie rock band trades in agreeable-emo vocals and earnest careerism. Yes, another one.

title: Exoteric
label: Load
description: Vocal-shredding Chicago duo Metalux collaborates with ever-prolific noise maven for a record of pounding rhythms and sporadic beauty.

title: Let Me Go Let Me Go Let Me Go
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Magnolia Electric Co. and Songs:Ohia singer-songwriter takes a few steps away from his recent full, collaborative sound.

title: The Top / The Head on the Door / Kiss Me, Kiss Me, Kiss Me / Blue Sunshine
label: Sire
description: The Top / The Head on the Door / Kiss Me, Kiss Me, Kiss Me / Blue Sunshine

title: Songs From the Coal Mine Canary
label: Durtro
description: Genre-bouncing New York songstress gets by with a little help from Antony.

title: The Triumphs and Travails of Orphan Mae/Troubled by the Fire
label: Raven Marching Band
description: The Triumphs and Travails of Orphan Mae/Troubled by the Fire

title: Born and Raised in Compton: The Greatest Hits
label: Arista
description: This best-of focuses on the oft-unheralded Compton producer and MC's solo work, which served as a more danceable foil to his hometown's nihilistic hedonism.

title: Skelliconnection
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop performer issues his second album, another impressive document of his intuitive and inventive songwriting.

title: Get Lonely
label: 4AD
description: John Darnielle's latest is a meditation on loss, inspired by the dissolution of a romantic relationship, and in its own way is as dark and brutal as his gut-wrenching 2005 album/memoir The Sunset Tree.

title: It's a Bright, Guilty World
label: Future Farmer
description: A typically direct and unassuming outing from Marty Leaper's Kinks/Beatles-obsessed project, with Robert Schneider of Apples in Stereo producing.

title: Young Mountain
label: Magic Bullet
description: Texas band creates brooding instrumental music that's heavy on atmosphere despite the relative brevity of the disc.

title: Second Attention
artist: Wooden Wand and the Sky High Band
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Latest record from the prolific James Toth is his first with new backing group the Sky High Band, and at least by his far-flung standards-- his most accessible and song-oriented collection to date.

title: The Shining
label: BBE
description: This posthumous release from the much-missed Detroit producer and MC was completed by Karriem Riggins and features guest spots from Common, D'Angelo, and Black Thought.

title: Happy Hollow
label: Saddle Creek
description: Tim Kasher's post-emo band tackles topics both deep and mundane on its latest Saddle Creek release.

title: Schmotime
label: Memphis Industries
description: Debut full-length from London quintet finds the gruff-voiced Dan Michaelson exploring sexual politics from every angle.

title: Anti-Anti
label: Jade Tree
description: Debut from brooding Atlanta four-piece is filled with crisp and efficient songs that mix the personal and political.

title: All Versus All
label: Transparent
description: The fourth collaboration between DJ Scud and I-Sound drifts away from beats to explore drone, noise, and free improvisation.

title: Bring Me the Workhorse
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: On My Brightest Diamond's debut, Sufjan Stevens-collaborator Shara Worden blends the artsy end of indie rock with classical touches to sometimes stunning effect.

title: The Body, The Blood, The Machine
label: Sub Pop
description: This Oregon-based, politically informed punk band return with their grandest, loudest, and most electrifying record to date.

title: Listennn...The Album
label: Koch
description: Miami DJ assembles an impressive assortment of guests (Beanie Sigel, Bun B, Young Jeezy, Kanye West) on an album that transcends the limitations of officially licensed mixtapes.

title: In Concert Volume One
label: Yep Roc
description: Powerful live album argues convincingly that the stage is where the versatile Sadies are most at home. Guests include Neko Case, Kelly Hogan, and Jon Langford, among others.

title: Classics
label: XL
description: Expert programmers Evan Mast and Mike Stroud follow their self-titled debut with a more refined collection of indie electronica.

title: Idlewild
label: Arista
description: Big Boi and Dre follow their highly acclaimed 2003 release Speakerboxxx/The Love Below with a soundtrack to a film in which they co-star.

title: Kill Them With Kindness
label: Polyvinyl
description: Kill Them With Kindness

title: Port of Miami
label: Def Jam
description: Rising Def Jam star follows his huge "Hustlin'" single with a debut album that leaves us no closer to learning anything about the MC.

title: Bande a Part
label: Luaka Bop
description: The French producers' second album of 80s covers in a bossa nova style tackles Billy Idol's "Dancing With Myself" and Bauhaus' "Bella Lugosi's Dead", among other new wave and post-punk classics.

title: A Lesson in Crime EP
label: Paper Bag
description: Much-ballyhooed indie upstarts offer twitchy micro-Strokes riffs  and hyper post-punk on this economical, promising EP.

title: The Complete BBC Peel Sessions
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Oft-overlooked Scottish indie band traces its five-album evolution from typical Sonic Youth/Pavement-worshipping fuzz junkies to soft-rock sophisticates on this collection of BBC sessions.

title: A Lazarus Taxon
label: Thrill Jockey
description: This 3xCD/DVD package collects singles, B-sides, and remixes released between 1995 and 2001-- including the whole of the band's long out-of-print remix EP Rhythms, Resolutions, and Clusters.

title: Impeccable Blahs
label: Euphobia
description: Eric Elbogen warbles about vampires atop a perch of sturdy if unremarkable indie rock. Again.

title: Kick Up the Dust
label: V2
description: Black Mountain bassist Matthew Camirand serves as lead singer and chief songwriter in this noirish Vancouver band.

title: Solo Guitar
label: Silber
description: This, um, solo guitar record finds the Low frontman exploring the physical.

title: Made In Brooklyn
label: Nature Sounds
description: Underrated, late-coming Wu member's latest features contributions from many of his Clan mates, as well as MF Doom.

title: So This Is Goodbye
label: Domino
description: The second album by this Canadian electronic indie pop band finds vocalist Jeremy Greenspan without the aid of founding member and presumed rhythmic engine Johnny Dark but in greater command of his elegant melodies, exquisite pacing, and marvellously tensile voice.

title: When I Live by the Garden and the Sea EP
label: Temporary Residence
description: Matthew Cooper presents this four-track EP, an addendum to his gorgeous 2005 album Talk Amongst the Trees.

title: Flashlights
label: self-released
description: St. Louis' band's sophomore release recalls Les Savy Fav and Dismemberment Plan, but expands the band's sound with horns, keys, and a 30 piece choir.

title: Avatar
label: Sub Pop
description: Ethan Miller and co. (which now includes Ben Chasny) follow the full-bore rock of Blue Cathedral with this more wistful, relatively calm release.

title: Let Me Introduce My Friends
label: Mute
description: This 29-member (!) collective actually hail from Sweden and balance a facility for hooks with the intimacy and joy found in much of the best indie pop.

title: Alter
label: Hydra Head
description: Alter

title: Kalas
label: Tee Pee
description: Ex-Sleep guitarist and current High on Fire vocalist/guitarist Matt Pike fronts these Bay Area doom rockers.

title: Dial 0
label: Soma
description: NYC electroclash artist drafts in the help of Antony, Autojulie 3000, and Jay Kauffman on his second album.

title: A Love Moderne
label: Force Tracks
description: Second album from the Swedish house producer who mixed the Digital Disco 3 compilation for the reinvigorated Force Tracks.

title: The Cursed Sleep EP
label: Drag City
description: Three-track EP provides a preview of Will Oldham's forthcoming The Letting Go.

title: And the Glass-Handed Kites
label: Sony
description: Danish band takes fairly normal indie reference points-- Radiohead, My Bloody Valentine-- and turns them into lavish, stratospheric, fairy-tale prog.

title: Tam
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Montreal music fixture has the tracks on her Ecstatic Peace release handpicked by Thurston Moore himself.

title: Have It All
label: Chicks on Speed
description: Part travelogue, part self-help manual, this English ex-pat-- who counts Peaches, Kevin Blechdom, Jamie Lidell, and Chicks On Speed among her friends-- uses her self-imposed alienation to examine personal truths.

title: Alternation
label: 5RC
description: Having put their own spin on ramshackle krautrock and busted house, the unremittingly experimental Excepter move toward a more organized sound and flirt with bona fide songs.

title: Sæglópur EP
label: The Worker's Institute
description: This addendum to last year's excellent Takk includes the title track, three previously unreleased outtakes, and videos for "Glósóli", "Hoppípolla", and "Sæglópur".

title: III
label: Homestead
description: Domino reissues the indie rock classic, adding an 18-track bonus CD and new liner notes. Released the same month as Nirvana's Nevermind, this album perfectly nailed the mussed, cynical, love-struck vibe of early-90s cassette-trading zinesters, and it still sounds fresh and remarkable today.

title: En Garde, Society!
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop-signed funnyman's second album finds him adrift in pop cultural dross-- albeit, often times with hilarious results.

title: Savane
label: Nonesuch
description: Last album from the recently deceased Malian master stands among his best.

title: Lunafied
label: Rhino
description: On this digital download exclusive, Dean Wareham and co. gather 15 covers-- of artists like Wire, Beat Happening and Harry Nilsson-- originally released on singles and EPs.

title: Psychocandy / Darklands / Automatic / Honey's Dead / Stoned & Dethroned
label: Blanco y Negro
description: Rhino reissues the first five albums from this famed Scottish band; each CD has been remastered and includes music videos.

title: Nightlife
