title: Desert Doughnuts
label: Voodoo-EROS
description: Sierra Cassady (CocoRosie) and Matteah Baim create dark, spacious lullabies on their debut LP as Metallic Falcons.

title: Rock Bottom Riser EP
label: Drag City
description: New EP from Bill Callahan features two tracks from A River Ain't Too Much to Love, two new songs, and two videos.

title: Houdini Live 2005: A Live History of Gluttony and Lust
label: Ipecac
description: Like it says on the tin, this is a 2005 live recording of the Pac Northwest band performing its Houdini album.

title: Hidden City of Taurmond
label: Load
description: Lightning Bolt bassist Brian Gibson mans the drums for this album, released concurrently with his Sponge Bob-cum-Harry Pussy cartoon bonanza, Barkley's Barnyard Critters: A Mystery Tail.

title: Fuel on Fire
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Pacific Northwest band takes cues from hardcore and 80s college rock, emphasizing moody tension over catchy drama.

title: So Gone
label: Misra
description: This Oklahoma trio follow a path laid down by Grandaddy and currently trod-upon by Band of Horses, making music that evokes open skies and horizons stretching for moonlit miles.

title: Don't You Know Who I Think I Was?: The Best of The Replacements
label: Rhino
description: Rhino collects 18 of the best tracks from America's quintessential 1980s rock critic band and adds two recent songs cut by the surviving members.

title: Blood Money
label: Interscope
description: The seemingly declawed hip-hop combo tosses its stark nihilism for G-Unit-aided pop.

title: Color Wheel
label: Troubleman Unlimited
description: Another record of effects-laden guitar meditations from this Troubleman duo.

title: Bottoms of Barrels
label: Team Love
description: Team Love band offers another mature take on immaturity, an album that celebrates the tactile and emotional world with the verve of unjaded perception.

title: Begin to Hope
label: Sire
description: Third album from the intelligent, eccentric singer-songwriter is her first recorded under major-label contract.

title: Rather Ripped
label: Geffen
description: Latest album from the legendary NYC band is also its tautest, a record full of propulsive, three-minute art-pop songs.

title: Cast Away the Clouds
label: Double Agent
description: Former Tiger Trap and Softies leader swaps cuddlecore for MOR.

title: Ache Hornes
label: Free Porcupine Society
description: Latest from the husband-wife duo of Rob Fisk (Deerhoof) and Kelly Goode also features Zorn-Cline-Bungle collaborator Ches Smith (on drums) and Xiu Xiu's Jamie Stewart (vocals, guitar).

title: Ok-Oyot System
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Thrill Jockey presents this collaboration between Otieno Jagwasi and Onyango Wuod Omari of Kenya's Orchestra Extra Solar Africa and Ian Eagleson and Alex Minoff from the D.C.-based Golden.

title: Son of Schmilsson / A Little Touch of Schmilsson in the Night / Everybody's Talkin': The Very Best of Harry Nilsson
label: RCA
description: Two reissues and a well-selected compilation from the offbeat singer-songwriter.

title: The Occult Hymn EP
label: Adultswim.com
description: Free, download-only EP of remixes, plus one new track, from the collaboration between Danger Mouse, MF Doom, and the Cartoon Network's Adult Swim.

title: The Ultimate Destroyer
label: Southern Lord
description: This throwback metal album-- issued on Southern Lord-- features chugging riffs and gruff, meaty vocals.

title: The Only Thing I Ever Wanted
label: Domino
description: London-based duo offers a second album of cuddly electronic indie pop.

title: Conference of the Birds
label: Holy Mountain
description: Al Cisneros and Chris Hakius follow Variations on a Theme with another collection of lengthy, addictive, metal-inflected music.

title: Who Loves the Sun OST
label: Merge
description: Superchunk's Mac McCaughan displays his expanding compositional palette on the soundtrack to this indie film.

title: The Sun Awakens
label: Drag City
description: Ben Chasny's eighth album under the Six Organs tag, expertly recorded by the Fucking Champs' Tim Green, is more subtly layered and focused than its predecessors.

title: Plume
label: Kranky
description: Scott Morgan's fourth Loscil album, like his others, explores calm, textured, emotionally neutral space.

title: Derdang Derdang
label: Domino
description: London-based group takes the majority of its musical cues from the blues and 1960s garage rock but avoids the trappings of its influences.

title: The Exchange Session, Vol. 2
label: Domino
description: Second volume of collaborations between Four Tet and the grizzled jazz sage was recorded at the same London session as its predecessor.

title: El Perro del Mar
label: Memphis Industries
description: On her second album, Swedish singer-songwriter Sarah Assbring makes mopeyness enticing, expressing her misery through musical elements typically associated with 1950s and 60s pop exuberance.

title: A Punch Up the Bracket / Punker Than You Since '92
description: Latest full-length and a 2xCD compilation from Stewart Anderson's long-running, long-suffering indie pop band.

title: The Last of the Rock Stars
label: High Coin
description: This comeback album from the former Ronettes star features guest turns from Keith Richards, Patti Smith, and Nick Zinner, among others.

title: Gypsum Strings
label: Brah
description: Prolific indie rock band's second album in four months is looser and more carefree than its predecessor.

title: Me Myself and Rye
label: V2
description: The best of Canadian singer/songwriter Matthew Adam Hart is gathered on this Memphis Industries release, the pop art performer's first outside of North America.

title: Be Your Own Pet
label: Interscope
description: Thurston Moore's Ecstatic Peace label issues the debut LP-- sure to garner Yeah Yeah Yeahs comparisons-- from this young indie rock group.

title: Riot City Blues
label: Columbia
description: Shapeshifting UK veterans abandon electronics and krautrock for another excursion into trad-rock and garage-blues.

title: Enemies Like This
label: Astralwerks
description: Hurricane Katrina, corporate greed, and, uh, the gentrification of Brooklyn are among the topics covered on this pseudo-political punky reggae party.

title: The Purple Album
label: Koch
description: Despite a tangential relationship to Cam'ron's crew, this hip-hop collective carries none of his avant-gardisms and only features one Dipset guest spot... and it's from Jim Jones.

title: Moo, You Bloody Choir
label: Sony
description: Australian band creates another album of literate, studied music richly adorned with unexpected turns of phrase, both lyrical and musical.

title: The Tommy Boy Story, Vol. 1
label: Rhino
description: Rhino compiles a 2xCD disc with the best of Tommy Boy's early years, focusing heavily on Akrika Bambaataa and electro, but also including hip-hop, techno, and house.

title: Let's Get Out of This Country
label: Merge
description: On its third album, the Scottish indie pop group parts with band member John Henderson and continues to distinguish itself the old-fashioned way-- with memorable melodies and engaging lyrics.

title: Enter
label: Flameshovel
description: Flameshovel band adds sparse, though undeniably seamless, moments of heavy metal grandeur to its mostly math-rock noodling.

title: Tulenkantaja
label: Huume
description: New album from Sasu Ripatti (Luomo, Vladislav Delay) is a mix of subaquatic soundbanks, reverb, and the inner infinities of repetition.

title: Diadem of 12 Stars
label: Vendlus
description: Metal band blends elements of folk and goth to create a dark, haunting album that's as gorgeous as it is ugly.

title: Get Physical, Vol. II
label: Get Physical
description: The dominant mid-00s German dance label offers another engaging mix of vocal house, disco revivalism, grinding minimalism, pulsating Detroit techno, and trance anthemics.

title: Scale
label: !K7
description: The dance producer's latest release is another wobbly step down his idiosyncratic path of torch songs, high-end sampledelia, and disco motion-- as well as one of this year's great albums.

title: Hundred Million Light Years
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt's Japanese neo-trance producer follows his sublime Special Life with more of the same. That's not necessarily a good thing.

title: Oh No! Oh My!
label: self-released
description: This indie pop group's relaxed, effortless, self-released debut is drawing comparisons with the Shins and Simon & Garfunkel.

title: A Vintage Burden
label: Kranky
description: Tom and Christina Carter's meditative new album is a striking about-face from the mystical abstractions of its predecessor, 2004's Joy Shapes.

title: Multiply Additions
label: Warp
description: IDM nerd-turned-whiteboy soul singer compiles an album's worth of remixes, featuring the work of Herbert, Four Tet, and Freeform Five, among others.

title: Son
label: Domino
description: On her fourth full-length, the former television star from Argentina sharpens her songwriting focus, delving even deeper into relentless and hypnotic repetition.

title: Feu Thérèse
label: Constellation
description: On this project, the scraping guitar of Pan Am's Jonathan Parant joins the psych electronics of Shalabi Effect's Alexandre St-Onge to commemorate Luc Ferrari, a French composer known for textured tape works.

title: Beneath Confederate Lake
label: Empyrean
description: This rarities release is a welcome companion to last year's lushly orchestrated comeback record, The Night's Bloom.

title: New Tones
label: Ubiquity
description: The Michigan group's Afrobeat-inspired music coalesces into a harder, funkier, and more galvanizing sound on its latest album, which includes a Joanna Newsom cover.

title: The Complete Motown Singles, Vol. 4: 1964
label: Hip-O Select
description: Latest in the incomparable chronicling of every A- and B-side released by Berry Gordy's famed soul label finds Hitsville USA beginning to earn its nickname.

title: Honey From the Tombs
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Solo debut from the Stars co-leader is, like recent records from Jenny Lewis and Isobel Campbell, a country-tinged excursion by an indie singer-songwriter.

title: Detail From the Mountain Side EP
label: Drag City
description: This brief EP sadly takes its lyrics from a Brian Torrey Scott play.

title: Under the Covers, Vol. 1
label: Shout! Factory
description: The jangly, power-poppers cover tracks by the Bee Gees, Neil Young, and the Beatles, among others.

title: Mobile
label: Nonesuch
description: Wilco drummer creates a solo record rooted in Steve Reich, the thumb piano, and a variety of rhythmic puzzles.

title: Fundamental
label: EMI
description: Famed electronic duo eases gracefully into middle age on this mature, mannered record.

title: Untitled EP
label: self-released
description: Covers and live EP, made available as a free download in honor of departing member Chris Cohen, features reworkings of tracks by the Beatles and My Bloody Valentine.

title: Imaad Wasif
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Fragile, acoustic melodies from the Yeah Yeah Yeahs' touring guitarist.

title: Wolves in Wolves' Clothing
label: Fat Wreck Chords
description: Pop-punk veterans still know their way around a hook and are still offering anti-Bush polemics.

title: To Find Me Gone
label: Dicristina
description: The second album from Andy Cabic and co. finds them nudging toward the lost canyons of airy West Coast soft-rock and laid-back, country-tinged introspection.

title: Personal File
label: Columbia
description: This 2xCD set of unreleased tracks, mostly acoustic, date as far back as the early 1970s and were recorded ostensibly for private listening, not necessarily for public consumption.

title: Trans Canada Highway EP
label: Warp
description: This six-track EP features four new BoC productions, an Odd Nosdam remix, and the Scottish duo's first music video.

title: Look at Who You're Talking To
label: Gigantic
description: Plainly derivative, this shoegaze-twee band comes off as weirdly refreshing all the same.

title: A Temporary Dive
label: V2
description: Like fellow Scandinavian José González, this Norway-born, Sweden-based singer offers sparse, English-language songs fluent in the well-established idioms of North American and British folk.

title: The Warning
label: Astralwerks
description: Electro-soul band's second album abandons the graceful, delicate melodies of its debut for songs with more wallop.

title: Audio Assault Course
label: self-released
description: Subtitled The College Radio Sessions, and attached as a bonus disc to Thunder, Lightning, Strike at select indie retailers, the EP selects six live cuts (plus Kevin Shields' dreadful "Huddle Flash" remix) to demonstrate the band's en vivo sound.

title: Macy's Day Bird / Black With Green Leaves
label: Important
description: With this 2xCD collection, Important combines two of Cluck's early releases, both of which were originally self-released in strictly limited editions.

title: Lightning Ghost
label: Kranky
description: Latest album from Town & Country co-conspirator Ben Vida's one-man army of lo-fi buzz-and-drone experiments.

title: Passover
label: Light in the Attic
description: Texas-based psych-rockers follow fellow drone lovers the Velvet Underground and Spacemen 3 on this Light in the Attic release.

title: Sexteen
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Veteran indie band's 16th effort is a "concept album about fucking."

title: It's Never Been Like That
label: Astralwerks
description: Third album from the meticulous French band finds its members loosening their ties, unbuttoning their cuffs, and coming across as the soft-rock Strokes.

title: The Trip
label: Family
description: After turns by Tom Middleton, Saint Etienne, and Snow Patrol, the former Pulp stars curate the fourth installment of the rewarding 2xCD mix series.

title: Asceticists 2006
label: Susan Lawly
description: Veteran group offers another delightfully divisive take on noise and power electronics.

title: The Dividing Island
label: Kemado
description: The art collective's new LP recalls sumptuously produced electro-orchestral New Pop and has the air of a carefully constructed artifact hermetically sealed under glass.

title: Blues and Boogie Shoes / All That Is Holy / Turn to Red
label: Fading Captain
description: Blues and Boogie Shoes / All That Is Holy / Turn to Red

title: The Obliterati
label: Matador
description: Second comeback album from the Boston post-punk band is the work of a group that's totally comfortable, and confident, within its own skin.

title: Simpatico
label: Sanctuary
description: If 1999's Us and Us Only was the UK vets' "Dylan album" and 2001's Wonderland their "Studio 54-era Stones album," this record could be called the band's "Jamaican album."

title: Songs From the Year of Our Demise
label: Pattern 25
description: After a lengthy wait, the co-leader of the Posies finally unveils his debut solo LP, and it's a melancholy, introspective album that feels like an extension of his group's work.

title: Wow Twist
label: Chicks on Speed
description: On its fourth full-length, this French laptop gang delightfully draw out the pop elements in its 8-bit electro sound.

title: Eyes Open
label: Interscope
description: Another competent effort from the former twee band, now practitioners of Coldplay-like dramatic ballads.

title: A Hundred Miles Off
label: Recordcollection
description: After two records packed with the kind of unrelenting, energetic furor that rock music built its rep on, Hamilton Leithauser and co. embrace blurred sonics and a Dylanesque squeal on their latest album.

title: Australia / New Zealand Tour EP
label: Popfrenzy
description: This uneven odds'n'sods EP, mostly comprised of limited-release vinyl tracks, was created as a souvenir commemorating Xiu Xiu's first tour of Oceania.

title: A Life Without Fear
label: Staubgold
description: German producer and theoretician delivers a fractured but surprisingly thorough look at the blues-- what it means, where it has come from, and how it left its fingerprints.

title: Tasankokaiku
label: Fonal
description: Finnish electro-instrumentalist quartet breezily mix the minimalist repetitions of Terry Riley with the analog shimmer of Broadcast.

title: Green Mind / Where You Been / J Mascis Live at CBGB's: The First Acoustic Show
label: Rhino
description: Green Mind / Where You Been / J Mascis Live at CBGB's: The First Acoustic Show

title: Music to Fall Asleep
label: Kompakt
description: Latest processed guitar-filled record from Kompakt Pop Ambient fixture Sebastian Meissner.

title: Detroit: The Dream Is Dead -- the Collected Works of a Midwest Hardcore Noise Band 1982
label: Touch and Go
description: Touch and Go compiles the entire recorded output of this Lansing, Mich., group.

title: Beneath Waves
label: K
description: K Records artist impressively navigates folk, dub, grunge-like rock, and more.

title: The Invisible Deck
label: Too Pure
description: This lively, politically charged record recalls X's boisterous male/female mantras and Sonic Youth's frosty downtown cool.

title: Monster of the Absolute
label: Strange Attractors Audio House
description: When compared to its predecessor, 2004's Satin Black, the latest from these Detroit space-rock vets is a model of precision that, at times, dovetails nicely with some of the more shoegazerly moments of Boris or Jesu.

title: The Spell
label: Touch and Go
description: The first BHP record made by a fully integrated band is also the group's best, fleshing out its already arresting sound.

title: Killa Season
label: Warner Bros.
description: Harlem Dipset magnate follows a string of relentless mixtapes and the soul-infused 2004 masterpiece Purple Haze with the soundtrack to a film about a hardscrabble hustler.

title: The Worthnothings EP
label: Stones Throw
description: Emerging from the same Los Angeles scene that spawned next-level soulsters SA-RA Creative Partners and J*Davey, this 22-year-old wunderkind makes her Stones Throw debut.

title: Do the Musiking
label: Pickled Egg
description: Avant/classical/folk duo Big Eyes add Rachel Grimes (Rachel's), Jeremy Barnes (Neutral Milk Hotel, A Hawk and a Hacksaw), and Scottish folkie James Yorkston to its family for a 29-track record that was three years in the making.

title: Pick a Bigger Weapon
label: Epitaph
description: Another strong effort from the Bay Area hip-hop group-- smart, politically aware lyrics couched in full-figured, Parliament/Prince digi-funk.

title: Powder Burns
label: One Little Indian
description: Greg Dulli resurrects the guitar drama of 2003's Blackberry Belle and continues to draw on specific 1990s alt-rock elements-- an extreme dynamic between verse and chorus and the belief that a soaring chorus is half the message.

title: II
label: Drag City
description: Now a sextet, this Philadelphia band's latest is far darker, deeper, and more ominous than its predecessors.

title: News & Tributes
label: Vagrant
description: Sunderland band's sophomore album-- released in the UK this month and the U.S. in June-- jettisons its predecessor's blood-pumping compactness in favor of a less focused sound stretched out across a larger sonic space.

title: The Mezzanine
label: Warm
description: These Brooklynites-- owners of the Apestaartje imprint-- assemble eight discrete tracks that function as immersive atmospheres in miniature.

title: Yes! Tinnitus!
label: Too Pure
description: This eclectic, bombastic record-- originally released in 2004-- finally makes its way to U.S. shores.

label: Drag City
description: This is the debut album by a new project led by Carl Barât, the less tabloid-ready ex-Libertine.
